productDescription:
The secret is Power AirFryer Pro's Rapid Air Technology that cooks food with a whirlwind of super-heated air for that great crispy-fried taste without all the added fat and calories. The Power Air Fryer Pro is a full oven multi-cooker that gives you all of the crisp, juicy, delicious, healthier benefits of oil-free air frying. You get a state-of-the-art air fryer with an added rotisserie and dehydrator— all in one! Just choose from 8 One-Touch Pre-Set Buttons to air-fry extra crispy chicken fingers; air-fry rotisserie for savory pork roast, mouthwatering turkey breast, or authentic kebabs; you can even use the dehydrator to make healthy dehydrated vegetables, herbs, fruit, and more— with no added sugar. The secret is the stainless steel Air Flow Racks and 1700 watts of 360° Air Flow Technology. You food cooks on both the top and the bottom for that great crispy-fried taste and texture— without all the fat and calories!



The 7-in-1 Power AirFryer Pro was designed as an all-in-one multi-use kitchen powerhouse. Not only can you fry food using super-heated air with little to no oil, you can cook tender, delicious rotisserie chicken, kebabs, and more or dehydrate your favorite meats, fruits, and veggies. You get the mouthwatering meals you love in just minutes without added oil or expensive restaurant bills. With very little clean-up time!

reviews.reviewText: It was great untill it stopped working. It went completely dark no power

reviews.reviewTitle: The warranty is only good for 60 days
reviews.reviewText: This fryer performed very well while it was working. I received it as a Christmas gift and used it up until Monday of this week, when it suddenly shut off. The warranty is only good for 60 days, so knowing I would probably not get any help from their customer service, which I sadly found to be true, I looked up the problem in the manual. Under "Troubleshooting" in the manual it said the fryer probably overheated, to unplug it and let it cool off a while. I did exactly as it said and left it unplugged overnight. The next morning I plugged it back into the outlet and turned it on. It blinked like it was going to work, then it shut off and never started again. It seems that the whole idea of this oven is a great idea, but the company does a very poor job of making it. I think anyone that buys it should be aware of the 60 day warranty, and understand if anything happens after that time,the company will not stand by its product!
This air fryer must have plastic inside because it sells of plastic. When you cook some foods, the food taste like plastic.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fryer was great, food tasted amazing
reviews.reviewText: Fryer was great, food tasted amazing! Had for 60 plus days, try to hydrate fruit, next thing I know, it no longer works.

reviews.reviewTitle: BEWARE - the two month warranty is hidden! That's right, only two months.
reviews.reviewText:
Nothing says, "this is a complete piece of junk" more than a two month warranty from the people that built the device. If they don't believe in their product - why should you? Let's be honest, you can buy perishable food products today that have a longer warranty that this overpriced, TV hyped, and poorly built product. And the vast majority of the people that buy this device will never notice that the 60 day return policy is also the warranty until after the purchase because it is so well hidden is the the hype and fine print. While this is a highly unethical practice, no one is calling them out on it - but I intend to.

And the real shame is, you will need a good warranty because these units have a nasty habit of failing in the first year. But don't take my word for it, just look at the feedback from many of the buyers and do a few online searches. People are very angry about this situation.

My unit lasted 6 months before it failed hard and the manufacturer does not supply parts or have a repair facility. So that works out to roughly $16 a use (not including - time, electricity, or food cost) if we used it 10 times in 6 months at a purchase price of $167 before it goes in the trash. Who in their right mind would consider that any kind of value or a logical purchase? Not to mention $167 buys quite a bit of food cooked by someone else.

If you need an air fryer, buy one with an actual 1 year or longer warranty. Most reputable manufacturers will offer them and you can find those better products here on Amazon

Junk. Rotisserie is so poorly designed we could not use it. Catch pan at the bottom was used one time, washed by hand and the coating wore off in spots. Under cooked chicken, and fries. Looked at trouble shooting tips for the fries it says if not cooked properly you are using the wrong kind of potato!!! No mention of what kind of potato to use?? Avoid buying this unless you want an expensive paperweight.
Worked great for a while. Love the results. Stopped working after fewer than 10 uses. Unit will not power on. I plugged it into multiple working outlets so... has to be the unit.

I had this product for only 3 days and then it just suddenly stopped working. The fan quit working first, then the inside light and now the whole unit is dead! Not only that, but it puts out a horrible burning plastic smell that seeps into the food and all of the accessories are a pain in the ass to get in and out. I'm sending it back and demanding a refund.

I love,love,love this product. I have cooked pork chops,chicken tenders,roasted veggies, dehydrated bacon and today rotisserie chicken,(on the chicken 4lb max) cornish hens work great.
Very happy.

We purchased ours off the TV. We loved it, cooked food wonderfully. We had it 69 days when the fan that pushes the air stopped working and you could smell plastic burning. I called customer service for the product and was told I was out of the 60-day window for the warranty. They could do nothing to help me. No offer to fix it at my cost of anything. I cannot recommend this product!
It was and amazing product when I was working. I used this product 3 times, the fan stopped working and it never worked again.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this oven fryer and most things you do not ...
reviews.reviewText: to the person that burned their hands use hot pads!! it's not that hard to figure out. it your racks fell then you did not have them in straight because i tried everything i could think of to get mine to fall and the only way it happened was if it was not in the same line as the other side then it fell. I love this oven fryer and most things you do not have to turn over half way through and they are done and moist because of the 360 degree cooking love love love this air fryer

the fry basket is very cheap and broke the 1st day I got it. the rotating mechanism doesn't even work even after they sent me a replacement it's still doesn't work please don't waste your money or time on this product it does not work as a claim that does a lot of useless coupons that they send along with their product keep your money by something a whole lot better
Product works but not as advertised. Cook times are much longer than stated. Took 4 weeks to receive unit.
Oven worked one time and then quit (the fan stopped running).. Very poor quality product. Would never purchase again.
Caught on fire at the first use

I bought this item off the TV infomercial. MISTAKE.
Every breaded thing I tried to cook stuck to the trays - impossible to wash by hand!
If I loaded up all five (even three) trays to dehydrate or fry, nothing cooked evenly. The top tray got brown and crispy while the bottom remained gooey and uncooked. I tried rotating the trays, which ended up taking things twice as long as the oven would have. Definitely not convenient!
It's great for heating up leftovers, but any cheap toaster oven or microwave will do the same.
VERY DISAPPOINTED! And now, I have to pay shipping to return this piece of crap. NOT happy.
Great product! But do not put anything on the top of it while it’s running!

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working on the second time it was used.
reviews.reviewText: The first time it was used I air fried some potatoes, they were cut like french fries and placed in the mesh basket, set the default setting for french fries. Most of the fries came out raw so I tried again, then some of them were raw, the other ones were okay, but not good. The second time it was used was to air fry some yellow plantains, everything was set up in a rack. I set the setting for french fries because it seemed appropriate, but the fans did not kick in, which seemed a little off. I waited a few hours trying everything in between the hours, but no fans kicked in. I followed the manual before and during the usage of this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: BEWARE: Everythibg fails after the 60 day warranty.
reviews.reviewText:
Got it off the TV infomercial. I have a tribest brand blender that has been a workhorse for about 15 yrs with no problem so I didn't think anything of the short 60 day warranty they offer. The food I have cooked in it turns out great and it's pretty easy to clean. That's the end of the positives.

First the drop pan on the bottom started chipping. I looked online and saw it was a common problem so I called the company. I was just past my 60 day warranty, so they wouldn't even replace it. All they offered was how to purchase a new one. Why would I purchase another faulty piece? Anyhow I looked some more online and I guess most people cover it in foil, so I decided it wasn't that big of a deal and continued to use it
Now I've had it about 5 months and used it maybe 15 times and the fan has stopped. I don't keep it under a cabinet like some people so there's lots of ventilation when I use it. After last time, know to not even bother with customer service again so I again go online to see what's going on. I guess it is yet another common problem. Thankfully my husband is very handy and I think we can fix it. I would not recommend this product to anyone unless you get a chance to get it at costco or some other place with a great return policy.
Check out the Facebook group if you are interested to see all the issues people have And the fixes.
Used it once worked Great! Turned around to put in some chicken nuggets for the kids and everything lit up but the fan wouldn't run. Had to pay $65 to return it!!! Not Happy!
From the first day that I got it I use it a total of 7 * went to go use it today and it's just not working anymore no lights no nothing
Made the entire house smell like plastic, had to return.
Returned. It burns/ over cook the meat.

reviews.reviewTitle: The air fryer literally burned out less than 2 months ...
reviews.reviewText: The air fryer literally burned out less than 2 months after I purchased it. The company refuses to give a refund ,buyer beware

reviews.reviewTitle: The fryer is super easy to use and clean up is a snap
reviews.reviewText: This air fryer is everything it claims to be. So far we have fried potato wedges, pork chops, cornish game hens, venison sausage, steaks, bacon and more. Everything comes out perfectly. The fryer is super easy to use and clean up is a snap. The racks, spit, basket and drip tray all go in the dishwasher. When cooking particularly drippy things, like bacon, I cover the drip pan with tin foil which makes clean-up even easier. I love this oven and highly recommend it.

Most of the people, my error - correction all the people ( about 20) in my nutrition class hate the product after ordering it, and so do I. Interior is too small, Can't use but a couple of racks for 4 pieces of chicken, and at the most can only cook 4 pieces due to room space and does not leave a fried chicken look. Does not crisp up. I would love to return the thing

Received it today. Opened the box to find the three Cook books that are provided and only about 25 pages long and nothing you really want to eat. Recipe for white bread is “buy frozen dough, thaw and add a stick of butter”. Cheese melt is “frozen mozzarella sticks, American cheese, butter and a slice of bread”. There is a picture of French fries on the cover of the cook book, but no recipe. Pretty sure it would be “buy frozen French fries and cook”. I went online and looked for a cook book designed for this unit and it is over $100. Not happy before I even plug it in.

reviews.reviewTitle: You Need this In Your Life!
reviews.reviewText: I love this kitchen gadget! I bought this for my husband’s birthday and we use it at least twice a week! We’ve made avocado fries, potato chips chicken, quesadillas, fries, and lots more! I have friends with the basic basket air dryers and feel like I can do so much more with this model. I love the removable shelves, the rotating basket, the crumb tray... so many options! I highly recommend it! My only small critiques are that the directions for use are pretty basic. There is a lot of trial and error figuring out what each button does. (Rotation, fish, chicken, etc.) It is also very large, so prepare to have it take over your counter.

Had this product for 6 hours and one use before it quit working. Googled troubleshooting this unit and found several complaints of the same nature as ours. One customer posted a video on YouTube demonstrating same issue. Only reason that we're ok with a one star review (wish we could give 0) is their customer service was friendly and helpful. They must get a lot of these calls. As soon as we described the problem, there was no hesitation in the solution, RETURN! And, thanks to Amazon's return policy, that's easy.
Bottom line, buy another brand!

reviews.reviewTitle: Microwave your potato recipes first if you don't like your potatoes eldente
reviews.reviewText: We read reviews and almost didn't buy it. But we decided to try it. For fried food we've made French fries, tator tots, and a hash brown casserole. Rotisserie we've made roast beef (a round eye roast) and a whole chicken. Everything came out perfect. I normally don't fry foods in oil, I use the oven which takes a long time. The air fryer cooks foods in almost half the time. I'm thinking that's a savings right there on electricity. The rotisserie is amazing, I thought the meats would be dry. Not at all, very juicy! So easy to use.. Our microwave gives us kiosk instructions. The air fry gives icons of what button to press. 😀 If you love frozen fried foods, this is the way to go. No more fry daddy's. Just put it in the air fryer. Taste just as good. I saw a review about the dehydrator. My cook book says it takes sometimes 24 hours. Well that's quicker than hanging jalapenos in the window for a few of weeks.. Just saying lol.. Everything it comes with seems to be heavy duty. I've put everything in the dishwasher, except the bottom plate I hand wash it. I really can't see anything wrong with this product. I just thought it would be a gadget at first but now it's something I definitely will use on a regular basis. If it's not working return it. I don't know how many times I got a dud product.. It happens. Sorry I wrote a book. But but my husband and I are really impressed by this product. 😀

After only 1 month and 24 days the black non stick coating on the drip pan has started to peel, even after only using a soft dish cloth and mild dish washing liquid, this is unacceptable, and discouraging.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very disappointed. Rotisserie is very hard to use
reviews.reviewText: Very disappointed. Rotisserie is very hard to use. Dehydrator, the oregano took over 4 hours and still was not totally dried. I can do the same thing in my oven at 220 degrees for 10 minutes. We will be returning this item ASAP.

Very disappointed. I bragged and boasted to friends and family about the AirFryer. After a month or so the on button seemed to not work. I would press it but nothing happened. October 19. 2018 was the return deadline date. It's November 13, 2018, and my fryer no longer fries it do nothing. I press the button it act as if it's going to work and then turn itself off. What's my resolve? Well I would like to have the fryer but at this point...a refund would be great, but again...what's my resolve?

I bought this for my mom on 11/26/2018 as a Christmas gift. She was DYING to have 1 since forever. She was ecstatic when she unwrapped it on Christmas Day. She used it for the 1st time on 1/7/19. She said everything turned out perfectly fine. She went to use it again LATER THE SAME DAY and it wouldn’t turn on. The light to indicate it is on turned on then turned off. She read the manual and it said to do a reset you just let it cool and leave it unplugged over night. She did that and went to use it the next afternoon. Same thing happened! I was OUTRAGED! Luckily the manual says there is a 60 day warranty on this machine so I’m just going to return it since reading the reviews I saw that this is a trend! I had no idea. Now I read the reviews for EVERYTHING but I didn’t read them for this since I knew this was what my mom wanted and just bought it. Never again! This thing is terrible! She got 40 minutes out of it!

If you have ever watched the infomercial on TV it shows awesome looking chicken coming out of the oven. I have tried to cook chicken in it a few times. With the thermostat turned up even higher than the cook book tells you and doubling the time it recommends the chicken comes out looking raw still. Don't waste your money. Looks like a healthy alternative to frying but it just doesn't work at all. Total junk from China. Waited too long to return it, now it is time for the trash can.
So cheaply made, finally caved in after a year of looking at Info martial, what mistake, returning after 1hr of receiving

Read and followed all the instructions, not difficult to set up. Made a small Turkey breast and it turned out great. 3 days later, I put a pork tenderloin on the rotisserie and plugged the machine in, it flashed on and the dash went dark and wont turn on. Unplugged and plugged back in several different outlets, power wasn't the issue since the power button was lit up. Very disappointed since it did great the one time I got to use it. Amazon was remarkable with allowing me to return the cooker.

reviews.reviewTitle: The food has been delicious, and the wings we made came out perfect. I'm not leaving 5 stars because
reviews.reviewText:
Update:
The company sent us a new pan that is great so I updated to 5 stars.

We've only had this product for 3 days but it works really well. The food has been delicious, and the wings we made came out perfect. I'm not leaving 5 stars because the nonstick oil drip pan has already started flaking after only 2 uses. I've contacted the seller and will update to 5 stars if the situation is resolved. I don't want those toxic little flecks being blown over my food during cooking.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Air Fryer...just don’t let the drip tray overflow!
reviews.reviewText: So, this is a nice, roomy Air Fryer! However...you better pray the drip tray doesn’t overflow with grease...it’s a disaster! Been there. There’s places where it leaked out all over our countertop...and I had to take apart the bottom to clean all my the grease out. I would recommend this product to a friend, with a warning about keeping an eye on it when cooking extremely greasy items.

reviews.reviewTitle: Yup. I'd buy this again and will be gifting it to friends.
reviews.reviewText: I waited two month to write a review. Loved this product but needed to try out everything it could do. I've cooked jerky, rotisserie chicken, rotisserie sausage, dehydrated fruits and veggies chips, scallops, fish, shrimp, fried okra, the best bacon ever, home made red potato fries, chips, and scallop potatoes, and roasted many different veggies. All turned out good to excellent.....good the first time and excellent once you refine the recipe. Plus for this unit over others I investigated are it's ability to do multiple racks of dehydration, air frying, or a rotisserie. Others with just a drawer were not able to do all of that. Rotisserie is incredible. Where it lacks is the three recipe books. They are weak, but do get you started with ideas. Try some but expect to surf the internet or even buy a few books on air frying. Cleaning can require a little work depending on what you cook. Unit has lots if preset settings for foods but you soon realize none of them are optimal to the best results. Quite a bit more expensive than less capable units but if you want something that works well and you can use for many great meals, buy one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Extremely upset with missing airflow racks and rotisserie rotisserie fetch ...
reviews.reviewText: Extremely upset with missing airflow racks and rotisserie rotisserie fetch tool Both items were supposed to come with us I will be returning extremely unhappy

reviews.reviewTitle: Use it right away to make sure everything works & you understand the functionality.
reviews.reviewText: I followed the instructions for the rotating basket but when I put the right side in place where they indicated, the basket wouldn't turn. Frustrating.

This is a great appliance and I used it for most of my meals. It had no issues until about 3 months after I bought it, and it stopped heating up. The fan would blow but no heat would come out, so I couldn't cook my food. The warranty is only good for 2 months, and the returns are closed after 1 month, so if yours goes out on you there's nothing you can do about it. They should allow returns or exchanges since it's a product malfunction
EDIT: Amazon was able to let me do a return and refund me. Gonna get a different model

reviews.reviewTitle: Must be Recalled/Bad Burnt Plastic Smell
reviews.reviewText:
We used it for precooked frozen chicken. It came out not eatable. It must be a manufacture defect. We are not willing to try again.
I don't think it is healthy to eat a food with "plastic" fumes.
Sorry

PS: the item was returned and a full refund was made available into my account in 2 days. We love Amazon for this and so many other obvious reasons. Thank you guys

Husband & I were looking in different stores. Bed, Bath & Beyond & Kohl's. While looking in Kohl's, another customer approached us & said if we were going to buy an air fryer, make sure it has a rotisserie not just the drawer. That way you don't have to keep shaking it to get even cooking. This is perfect. I use it practically every night. Not just for french fries. I made pork chops, chicken wings, chicken breasts & salmon. It is great for leftover pizza. Doesn't dry out like the oven or become soggy like a microwave. My sister-in-law saw it & bought the same thing. Made delicious meatballs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Smell is BAD and will not burn off even after several uses
reviews.reviewText: I was so excited about getting this air fryer only to be greatly disappointed. It has a chemical smell that I cannot get rid of. After doing some research on how to get rid of that smell (that cooks into your food) it appears that others are having the same problem (according to the companies FB page from customer comments). I’m returning mine and searching for another one that won’t have this issue.

Returned it immediately. The plastic near the heating element can not withstand the heat and melts giving you an awful burnt plastic smell. I contacted the manufacturer and they do not cover it since I bought it from amazon. I’m sure it’d work great if the interior was metal.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is awesome, but I have a piece missing and they ...
reviews.reviewText: This is awesome, but I have a piece missing and they seem to not want to replace. The box was destroyed and the part is not in there
My wife was quite pleased with this air fryer until it became non responsive after only a week of use . Very frustrating .

I ordered this air fryer as a Christmas gift for my parents. When they got it out of the box it would not turn on. I requested a replacement January 2. Returned the defective one through UPS using the code I was given on January 8. Emailed seller January 13 asking for a status update on my replacement, and as of today, January 17, I have gotten ZERO response. As I said, this was a Christmas gift. I am very disappointed, as it appears I am out $150.

The oven didn't even make it through one cooking cycle. Tried to reset it by unplugging, and plugging back in... All of this while trying to cook chicken breast... Do not buy this oven. It does not work.

IF YOU LOVE FRENCH FRIES/ONION RINGS/CLAM STRIPS/FRIED ZUCCHINI YOU NEED TO GET ONE, THIS IS A "TOY" TO PLEASE YOUR CRAVINGS. SO EASY TO USE AND IT ALL TASTES GREAT, EVERYBODY SHOULD HAVE ONE. HAVE NOT TRIED ANY OTHER RECIPES SO FAR BUT I AM SURE WE WILL BE PLEASED.

reviews.reviewTitle: Unit not as useful as expected
reviews.reviewText: I don’t like giving negative reviews but I do not have a positive opinion regarding this air oven! it’s my fault for not reading a lot of the comments before I ordered it! I used this oven twice the first time I used it I put marinated pork chops on the rack to cook the drippings went down onto the base pan that you see in the picture when I got ready to remove the base pan the drippings were dark so I took it over to the sink ran hot water in thepan and let it sit for 20 minutes or so! As you can see it lifted the coating off of the pan! I find it’s too difficult to store everything that came with the unit and very cumbersome to take the time to use! I called the company to get a replacement pan and as yet I have not received it! I’m sure a lot of you will find this unit useful I will put it in the box and put it my garage because it’s just in my way.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t return it if it breaks.
reviews.reviewText: Don’t return it if it breaks. You won’t get it back. Sent ours back over 2 months ago. $160 purchase price, $48 return shipping wasted

The company does not stand behind this product. I used my product for the first time and the switch (to keep the machine on) will not work unless you hold the machine the entire time. Because the machine is out of the time for return, I’ve attempted to contact the company at least 2x. I’ve attempted to contact using 2 different email, to make sure that it wasn’t an issue of my email going through, but I receive responses from Amazon, but not the distributor. If you decide to buy this product from this company, my hope is you have better success than I.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the idea if it lasted.
reviews.reviewText: I like the design, but I have trouble getting the door to close tight enough so the over will start. I have to push the oven door closed several times to get the oven to start. Otherwise I live this. I am afraid that someday it will not start due to the door closing tight problem. I have not contacted the seller yet, as I have only used it a few times. Love the idea of not turning on the big oven. I did not use the oven much, now it just blows fuses. My husband smells something burning, inside. File 13, trash.

I love the features this product offers. The ability to cook with very little oil is beneficial to me in my desire to live a healthy lifestyle. I have cooked meats and they come out moist and delicious. I have tried many vegetables in this fryer and the outcome is very satisfactory, fried zucchini, baked squash, potatoes. Anything I have tried I have been pleased with.

Bad review due to the fact that it died within 1 year of owning it. I was obsessed with my air fryer and raved about it to everyone. It’s a MUST HAVE appliance, HOWEVER; if you want it to last several years, invest in the warranty. I’m torn on if I will stick with the same brand or buy a different one, but an air fryer oven is a must. I loved it while it worked but I don’t like the fact that the warranty is only 60 days.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't buy it in his web.
reviews.reviewText: But customers service, lying in the product & false in writing too, no recommendation.👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎
The best of the best. Just make sure you get all of your accessories. I realized months later I never got my fry basket :( and they don’t sell them individually to purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: All of a sudden it stopped working!!
reviews.reviewText: This product is a disappointment. I have used it for 6 months and up until last night it worked fine. Now I went to start it to cook a burger and it is not working. Nothing, nada happens. I unplugged it several times and plugged it again and NOTHING!!!! How do the manufacturers get away with this and Amazon should not carry something that is sooooo very unreliable. DO NOT BUY IT'S A PIECE OF GARBAGE! I will have to throw it out because the manufacturer only provides a 60 day return & warranty period and they don't even publicize a contact number for customer service.

The Bad: the racks don't seat well into the grooves on the sides, so flopsy. (dangerous as are very hot). 2 racks are flat- food rolls off. wires on sides of racks poke you while washing them. The Good: food is good. More convenient than using regular oven for small things (snacks).cleans up easily. It is okay- was expensive for me and has some design issues that bother me more than alittle. but so far has produced good end results. I am hoping mine lasts for more than the 60 days that some people have had the bad luck to experience:(.

We haven't even used our oven since getting the Air Fryer. In addition to all the other recipes, we do biscuits, pieroges, egg rolls; re-heat & crisp- up baked/fried chicken (wrap in foil until heated within, then uncover to crisp); reheats pizza w/o turning soggy. The 3 tiers are great! Would purchase again, and give as a nice gift. The price is good.

I have been looking for an air fryer for long and a lot of my friends had recommended buying one but they all have one complaint in common, theirs were too small and they have to wait to cook a meal for more than 2 people so I decided to go for this one cause was big and is the best decision ever. I use it for everything! It is worth it and I barely use my kitchen at all, everything is so fast and you can do other stuff while you are cooking.

Really worthy. Even though at Walmart might be 20$ cheaper.

The Power Air fryer has stopped working already the window for return only lasted 30 days and of course it's over the 30 days. It will cost me to close to the amount that I paid for it for me to return it for a replacement that will only last until the 30 days are up. Would not buy again. Waste of alot of money exspecially at this time in our country. Shame.
Quit working after 4 uses. Light comes on but computer screen with push buttons does nothing. Returned.
Wonderful! Cooked food great with no oils. A lillte confusing at first with using, but after a few days getting a hang of it. Worked great on french fries, pork chops and frozen pizza. Thumbs up.

reviews.reviewTitle: How many things can go wrong? Alot!
reviews.reviewText: So ok I'm going to make fries. I pull the door and it comes off! I reattach the door, put the fry basket in, and the basket won't turn! I flip the basket around, still won't turn! I let the fries stay in even though they aren't turning and smoke starts to come up from the bottom of the unit! Soooooo glad I bought it from Amazon! I can only imagine trying to return it to the manucrapturer!

reviews.reviewTitle: It is very easy to operate.

I was disappointed in the basket and the rotisserie spit as it looked like you could cook a chicken but a cornish hen would be the largest bird. I cut up and "fried" chicken the first time, rotating the shelves. It was OK. Not crispy. Next, I tried tater tots, zucchini and Brussel sprouts, the tots were crispy, the zucchini was excellent the Brussel sprouts were not good. Later in the week, we tried to use it to heat up the leftovers. The unit came on, the light came on, the unit would not turn on or off and we could not use any settings. The only "thing" that lit up was the on the button. The unit got very hot where the light is. We tried unplugging, waiting, trying again the next day, but we could not get it to work again. I did not ask for a replacement bc I don't want to go through this again. Not sure what I will try next.
My family and I enjoy the fryer, however; it has tripped my circuit breaker, and also the whole unit gets hot and it has burned my arm, so please beware!

I was very excited to get this air fryer. We had one of the older ones that we used for a long time. When I got it I followed the instructions completely. It said to preheat the unit to burn off oils on the inside. I did that and everything worked great. The next day when we went to use it the display was off and I could not get it to come back on. We unplugged it and tried a different plug in case that was the problem but it would not come on. Needless to say I have returned it.

Excellent product! The only thing is—don’t overload the basket, it will stop rotating! But the next time worked like a charm! Would like for the basket to be easier to clean. Other than that I love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Holds twice what my bucket shaped fryer did
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this airfryer to replace my smaller capacity bucket shaped fryer. I made my usual fried chicken breasts and they got just as crispy as usual. I don't do the three step breading suggested in included recipes as I prefer less breading to minimize carbs. I suggest a 2 hour brine then dipping in heavily seasoned flour and misting with oil.
Easy cleanup which isn't always the case with our small appliances. I fill the sink with hot soapy water, toss in shelves and drip tray, wipe the inside with a hot, damp cloth and then rinse the shelves and replace them. Easy peasy.

reviews.reviewTitle: I've used/tested the crap out of this thing
reviews.reviewText: I've used/tested the crap out of this thing. And overall pretty / sorta good. A few things. The 6qt will only hold a 3 1/2 pound chicken on the spit. Good luck finding a bird that small. The bottom drip tray is a fail. after about ten uses the non stick surface wears off with just cloth washing. All of the pre-set buttons are pretty much a waste. You'll end up setting a temp and time and checking with a temp probe for done. I don't use any of the presets. The front door is a mess. The clear panels are not sealed so water gets in-between them as well as other gunk. The slides for the trays are difficult to align, have to say I don't know how you fix that but if they really want to make an improvement the side slides should be removable for cleaning. As it its you can only kinda get them clean. Key one is make sure you totally dry anything you want to cook. If it has any water on it you just end up with steamed gunk.

reviews.reviewTitle: TERRIBLE PLASTIC SMELL THAT WONT GO AWAY!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this from Kohls on Saturday. I used it once and there was a terrible plastic burning smell. I washed everything again and ran the machine and the smell was worse. The chicken I initially made tasted fine but the next morning it smelt and tasted just like the plastic smell. I had to throw out my leftover meat. I haven’t been able to get rid of the smell. That’s a deal breaker for me. As much as I want to keep the machine I must take it back. I wish I had read a review about this smell before purchase.

I purchased this in February, 2018 and have used it less than 10 times. Last night I was cooking chicken breasts on the wire shelves and the oven turned off in the middle. I had to finish the chicken in my regular oven. I let the airfryer cool down completely and it still wouldn't come back on. No power/lights at all. I called Tristar's customer service this morning and was told that it's guaranteed for only 60 days. I wish I didn't waste my money on this junk.
Its okay.

This product only has a sixty-day warranty. We received this as a Christmas gift and used it maybe a couple of times a week. The other day, it was flashing "E2" on the screen. There is nothing in the manual that explains what that is so I called the customer service line (Not toll-free). I was told that that message meant the internal circuit was broken, and I was out of luck since the warranty was only sixty days. $150.00 for six months of use. I think the sixty-day warranty is probably indicative of its quality. They don't expect it to have a very long lifespan.

If you like to flip your food every 5 minutes so it won’t burn this is for you! The whole selling point is not having to flip food due to the moving air. I bought the oven on Father’s Day, and just two days later the rotisserie feature does not work anymore. I used it to cook one piece of chicken and it worked well for that. Will burn the top rack of onion rings and leave the bottom soggy. The mesh basket worked well for French fries, while it worked. But these French fries will not look like they do on the infomercial. They look like they came out of a plain old oven, brown and puffed up. The only thing I could actually find useful about this product is it doesn’t heat up your house like your oven will. Wouldn’t recommend this even if you aren’t planning on using the rotisserie. If mine broke in two days what else will happen over the course of a month.
Junk don't buy!!! Fan quit working in less than two weeks and we barely used it.

Further there are numerous complaints from customers online with the same complaint of defective fan but the company has done nothing to fix the problem, instead they keep sending the same defective model and ignoring the problem. So now I'm on a third unit which I have absolutely no confidence in it holding up. I just received the third one today, will return to upgrade review if the third unit is defective as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bought this with great expectations, worked great for about 60 days
reviews.reviewText: Bought this with great expectations, worked great for about 60 days, but as soon as the 60 day warranty expired, yes I said 60 DAY WARRANTY, the machine stopped working. Called customer support and they told me it's been over 60 days and there was nothing they could do for me but sell me a new one at full cost. It was out of warranty for maybe a week at best. I've since read numerous reviews where the exact same thing happened, just after warranty expired the fan went out or the heat element failed or any one of a dozen other problems, and they all got the same answer I did, nothing they can do but sell you another at full price. I will NEVER buy anything from this company again and neither should you.
