reviews.reviewTitle: Make sure you understand the warranty
reviews.reviewText: I bought this air fryer direct and at first I loved it, I love the concept of air frying (convection). But the day I got it the light when I turned it on flicker and never went on again probably a loose connection but I can’t figure out how to get in it to fix it. At this point I should have contacted the manufacture because I really didn’t care about having a light, until I went to clean it 2 plus months later. I found a crack in the interior wall of the oven (probably why the light didn’t work), it must have been dropped. But when I call customer care they told me I did not buy the extended warranty so there was nothing they could do about it. I said what i have had it for only three months. Well come to find out it’s warranty is only good for 60 days, what kind of product is only Warranteed for only 60 days. Now if I paid for it in the 4 installments they offer on the info-mercial I would have a piece of crap that I would still be paying for. Seems unfair.

reviews.reviewTitle: 2 for 2 Broken in a Few Months
reviews.reviewText: We bought 2, one as a gift and one to use. The 60 day warranty is not 61 days and customer support's answer to a problem is to buy a replacement. My son's air fryer was making noises after about 6 weeks, but worked. By the time they called support it was too late. We've used ours lightly maybe a dozen times and mostly for corn dogs and frozen pizza. But suddenly it sounded like this (hopefully the video will show) after just 3 months. It sounds like a part has come lose, but it's not usable as-is. It's too expensive to break down like this, and 2 for 2 is a poor track record for us. We are not alone, look at all the reviews.

Bought this today because I've started the KETO diet and it was obvious I was going to fry a lot of stuff and I wanted a more contained system than an open skillet and not my oven. I watched several videos on YouTube and got up to speed.

I cooked two dishes at same time. First I dipped chicken drumsticks in butter and then coated with grated parmesean cheese, then put mesh rack, which I'd sprayed with cooking spray, in highest slot. I cooked them for 16 minutes at 370, which is the automatic chicken speed.

I also had sliced Chinese eggplant rounds, which I coated in melted butter and topped with grated parmesean.

When the chicken had 16 minutes on top rack, I pulled it out, it was already browning, turned it over and put in in the lowest rack. I did not want chicken drippings on top of the eggplant.

I then put the rack with the eggplant in the highest slot and cooked for 10 minutes. Wow were they beautiful but almost done so I kept them out for 10 minutes while chicken cooked more. Then I turned eggplant rounds over, and cooked another 8.

Chicken was absolutely delicious. I was just knocked out by how moist and tender and crispy it was. Eggplant was also wonderful.

I figured anything advertised on tv would be just awful. I was wrong. I had sprayed all the removable parts with cooking spray so a bit of a soak and a bit of a scrub with kitchen brush cleaned the mesh racks. The teflon coated drip tray is a breeze.

I'll take photos next meal I make.

I'm very intimidated by the rotisserie function, btw, though I saw a gentlemen on YouTube using it like a breeze. But I don't much see the point. Why not just set a whole chicken on the lowest rack and bake it?

Update. Nite 2. Baked whole chicken. 45 minutes. Delicious. Mascarpone cheese mixed with butter and olive oil stuffed under skin. I could have done that in oven. Why heat up the whole house?

I was really excited to receive an air fryer as a house warming gift. My cousin and uncle ordered the power air fryer since they knew I wanted one with a lot of options. I couldn't wait to use it and the first couple of times it worked perfect. I put my toaster oven away since you could use this air fryer as a toaster as well. All seemed to be going well until I made my first meal. I made chicken legs and placed them on the rack correctly. They cooked nicely and I then cleaned the air fryer as instructed. The next day I went to use it to toast bread and it would not turn on. I tried everything, I unplugged and plugged back in a bunch of times, checked to see if the everything was placed back correctly and it still would not work.

When I would replug, the Airfryer electronic section would light up and beep and then turn off and the internal light of the air fryer would stay on even though the door was closed. I called Amazon and I must say they get 5 stars for customer service. They are giving me a refund for the item. I am so disappointed in the product since I really wanted to love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Spritz food w zero calorie veg oil 4 best CRUNCH.
reviews.reviewText: READ MY REVIEW due to how many negative reviews this fryer has verses the good, people either seem to love or hate it, I got this as a gift and nearly took it back w/o every trying it. I'm so glad I tried it out, my first time results turned out Perfect CRUNCHY tots, onion rings & fish sticks. I lightly spritzed my food items w zero calorie butter spray, a toaster oven trick I learned and BAMM... 15min at 400 and i was in Air Fried Heaven!! Due to complaints about smell from oven heating up, I ran it a 15min 400° empty cycle to pre burn anything off the heat element, no different than turning the heat on the first time in the winter & smelling a little funk. Food turned out AWESOME, no smell or funky taste from the unit. I am so glad I kept it and I'm going to use it constantly! Buy with confidence! Some said entire inside is plastic, mine is all metal, so I don't know what they're talking about???

reviews.reviewTitle: Like it but don't love it
reviews.reviewText: I bought it directly from their website, I love this AirFryer Oven but there are some negative things about it as well. First, it does work really well, you can fit a bunch of stuff at one time, and it mostly cooks every greatly. But in their rush to be the first with the Oven style they have some design flaws. like the trays are a pain to get in and out especially when they are hot. Then the Drum that comes with it breaks very easy making it so that you cant use it. The rotisserie is awesome if you get a chicken smaller than 4 lbs and can truss it really really good. Actually had a problem finding whole chickens under 5 lbs that weren't Cornish Hens. The Trays are really easy to clean if you let them soak if you get some parchment paper made for air fryers they make it non stick and easy cleanup. I have made jerky a couple times that came out pretty good. Overall i could go on and on but im sure there are better reviewers than me. I would buy this again, ( if price was lower ) but id probably go with one of the newer models that fixed most of these issues.

reviews.reviewTitle: He died last night. LATER HE REVIVED SEE BELOW.
reviews.reviewText: Bought my Power Air Fryer June 2918 at another place. Later read reports about them dying, fan going out, no customer service, no way to get another fan etc. But the Power Air Fryer was so convenient, easy to clean etc. My husband and grown son loved it also. Soon the fan started making noise so my Grandson took it apart and worked on it and even though it made some noise it still ran. I am so thankful for the 9 months we have had it. It is a shame that the workmanship in producing these is so bad when the concept is wonderful. UPDATE 4/12/2019 THIS IS IN CAPS IN HOPES THAT SOME OF YOU WHO THINK YOUR FRYER IS DEAD WILL READ THIS. LAST NIGHT MY GRANDSON CAME OVER, LISTEN FOR A SECOND AND SAID HE COULD FIX IT. HE TOOK IT APART AND A SCREW THAT HOLDS THE FAN CAME LOOSE AGAIN. THE AIR FRYER SOUNDS PERFECT AGAIN! This airfryer is so wonderful when it works so I am so thankful for a grandson that knows how to fix everything. Evidently it is an incredibly easy fix.
I LICK IT BUT DITH KNOW IT BE LEAF BY ROARD DONOT

I bought this hunk of junk off of their infomercial. I'd used it 3 times and just wasn't completely happy with it so I watched the infomercial again. I did not get what was advertised on TV!! That's deceptive!! Apparently I upgraded to the Elite oven? I wouldn't know because they are like snake oil salesmen. Try to get you to buy everything under the sun. I'm sending it back asap. I will not be buying another one, the one I wanted, after reading all the reviews here. Wish I'd have read them before I bought.

reviews.reviewTitle: High Price Tag For Low Quality! THIS THING IS DANGEROUS!!! IT IS A FIRE HAZARD!!!
reviews.reviewText:
We bought the XL about 3 months ago from a TV infomercial. I don't care if this is an Amazon review. People need to know this thing is dangerous! Product arrived in a timely manner and well packaged. The $100 in free "grocery" coupons isn't more than 50 cents off coupons for mainly non-food items but I wasn't surprised because this is what most companies would offer. The door is flimsy. Don't sneeze while it's open because it may break off! Washed all parts by hand and the finish on the drip pan washed off in spots. Hard to tell what some of the pictures are for the options and most don't make sense. 1st time I used it was to make a chicken recipe that was in their "cook book". It turned out GREAT! Crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. One of the features I was most looking forward to was the dehydrator so we excitedly gave it a try. My husband dehydrated some bananas and sweet potatoes for the dog. Sweet potatoes turned out perfect but the bananas were a bust! They never dried and only stuck to the rack. OK.. no bananas. I can live with that. We then tried (multiple times) to make french fries. Not one single time did they turn out crispy no matter what we did. Less than 1 month old and food began to stick to the rack. When I wash the rack (by hand) finish would wash off. 1 month later, It stopped turning on. It now takes us SEVERAL attempts to get the thing to run. Sometimes it doesn't turn off. If I open the door it will just keeps on running. When it does run it doesn't crisp. It takes twice as long to cook now than it did 1 month prior. It no longer holds temperature long enough to dehydrate anything. Not only does it not turn on when we want it to, sometimes it will actually just start running all of a sudden on its own. Last night we were watching tv in the livingroom and all of a sudden I saw light shining from the kitchen and heard it running. There's only my husband and I who live in the house and we were both in the living room. We either have a ghost or this thing is a fire hazard.

This item is a flimsy piece of junk that's going to burn someone's house down one day. I pray that no one gets harmed because of it.

I got my air fryer through the infomercial. I got it in December as a gift for my aunt, thinking it could help us eat a bit more healthy, but i ended up in the hospital until early may. And my aunt refused to use it(she isn't very fond of gadgets and electronics). So the fryer sat until i came home, and i only used it 6 times. It was awesome!...until it suddenly just stopped working. We never got to use the accessories, except for trying the rotisserie once. And when they say a four pound chicken, they mean it! My aunt got a chicken that was a single ounce over four pounds, and it wouldn't spin. We had to take it out.

But when it did work, oh, boy! Chicken breasts came out soooo tender and juicy. Fried foods came out crisp. I only had two things not go well, but they were due to user error

I absolutely loved this oven for about 5 months until it just stopped working. 60 day product warranty is all that is offered unless you purchase the extended warranty. I never got a chance to use the other features of the oven when it just died on me and customer service told me Sorry! You didn’t purchase the extended warranty so there is nothing we can do. For that reason I will never again purchase another Tristan product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Whats all the hub bub? low score givers....
reviews.reviewText: I see lots of 1 star ratings don't understand what the problem is .... I didn't even read the instructions and made chicken nuggets first... only 8 mins for 20 nuggets. next I did shimpkabobs and they were awesome. It does potatoes on the rack perfectly. I've done bacon and hamburgers. acorn squash stuffed with meatloaf... superb flavor and so juicy. It's perfect for a large group wanting toasted cheese bread. I gonna make fruit rings apples apricots and bananas later tonight.... can't wait. I have bought this guys products before and everything has been as promised .... I love em... Sorry for those who got a defective one. But definitely not junk...

reviews.reviewTitle: Great until it STOPS working after 6 months!
reviews.reviewText: This was the best thing ever....until the unit got too hot and warped the door. Now, you ask? In order to get the oven to start, I have to close the door repeatedly until the light *finally* goes off and it starts....only to stop as soon as it gets a little hot....repeatedly. Guess what? I get to close the door a bunch more times to get it to start again...and we repeat this until I give up and cook the items somewhere else...like the real oven. So - I chat with”customer service.” They disconnect my chat 3 times by letting it time out (looking things up to “help” me) or ask me questions that require me to look something up - voila, disconnected again! I finally figure out that I have to argue with the customer service chat guy “Allan” long enough to keep the information needed to compose the email I am instructed to send to “corporate,” because he can’t help me. Seriously? VERY poor customer service, VERY poor item - highly discouraged!

reviews.reviewTitle: Stay far away unless you like to waste money and time.
reviews.reviewText: Worst product ever. This is my second unit that has failed with only a couple of uses. 1st unit the rotisserie mover worked. It was replaced. 2nd unit the 3rd time using it the fan stopped working. Call customer care and I must ship it back to them on my dime to replace. Crappy warranty and crappy service. Will never buy another another of their products again. Please save your money and time. Not worth the hassle.

reviews.reviewTitle: They make it look great, easy and wow we wanted one!!
reviews.reviewText: First it had an awful plastic burning smell. we couldn't figure out why. Had to cook zucchini and chicken both longer than it said. I didn't feel so great and my honey got really sick. After reading these other reviews, wow, it is going back for a full refund (he bought it at a store). WHY WOULD ANYONE WANT TO KEEP IT IF IT'S ONLY 60 DAYS WARRANTY AND YOU READ ON AND ON THAT IT SUDDENLY STOPPED WORKING FOR OTHER PEOPLE. NOT WORTH THE TROUBLE. Sad. I mean the idea is great but put some quality into your product so it doesn't stop working. And the plastic burning smell is what made me feel sick. I didn't even want to eat the stuff. I made a PBJ after trying two zucchini sticks.
Don’t know bought as Birthday gift for our daughter.

What a train-wreck this thing is. Overall, it cooks excellently and is very user-friendly! But the thing has fallen apart after just a couple of months. The door has to be pushed against and held for a minute or so before it won’t keep stopping and turning itself off. The sound of it has changed immensely, as well. It stated out being pretty quiet, and now it rattles and doesn’t want to turn the basket evenly. Very frustrating, because all of this started after the very limited 30 day warranty expired. So we are stuck with it. Luckily, my father is the handiest of handymen and will figure out a way to fix it up. Just be warned when you get this. It could backfire on you!!

Do not purchase anything from this company. Purchase another brand.

I believe the copper lining of the fry basket of my AirFryer XL is defective. After a few months of use the copper lining is peeling off the interior cook surface. I have only used silicon utensils in it and washed it only with soap and a sponge. I have other copper cookware and all of that is fine.It's only the fry basket that has a problem.

I contacted customer service and was disappointed in the level of service I received. The online person suggested I exposed it to cold temperatures. The telephone support person suggested I put the tray into the fryer incorrectly. I assure you I did neither of those things, nor should either of those cause the interior cooking surface to peel.

I continued and spoke to a supervisor who told me there is no free replacement of the basket available after 60 days. I am expected to purchase a new fry basket for about $25. I truly believe the product is defective and am surprised the company will not warranty products beyond two months. 

Instead of spending $25 to replace a product that the company won't stand behind, I will purchase another brand. I suggest you do the same as well. It is my hope that my experiences with this company will save someone else from suffering the same fate. 

Expecting a company to stand behind its product for more than 60 days is not too much to ask. If they have no faith in their product then neither do I. It would have cost them very little to replace this fry basket. In today's consumer driven age I find it hard to believe for that small cost they are willing to lose customers.

Don't buy this one. I bought mine at BB&B and it died a bit after
the 60 day warranty. Also, there was a slight plastic smell when running.
It did convince me that air fryers might be good and I will now go buy
a brand that has better reviews.

Very dissapointing. I bought it mainly for fried stuff (french fries, fried chicken). I only dared to try the french fries. They never cooked. It was spinning and spinning for hrs, wasting electricity and in the end, I still had to use my regular oven. They were so soggy that they burned but never got crunchy. False advertisement :/

reviews.reviewTitle: I gotta stick up for this air fryer!
reviews.reviewText: I love my air fryer. I have had it for over a year and have had no problems with it. We use it daily because my 85-year-old mom says that it makes the best toast she has ever had! I have made several things with the rotisserie including chickens, Cornish hens, and bacon wrapped stuffed pork loins. I have made beef jerky about 30 times with the dehydrator. All these people saying that it won't work on the rotisserie function, I would bet that half of them have not read the instruction booklet or went to you tube or the Eric Theiss site to watch a video on how to work it. That is how I learned to use it and there are so many recipes out there to choose from. You can't just buy a product like this and expect to be able to use it correctly without doing a little research on it! I joined an air fryer oven facebook group and learned a lot of great info on there. I bought mine on the website that is named the same and bought a 6-year warranty at the same time. I don't think they offer that anymore on the site. I see that they offer a 4-year warranty above for $29, so those of you griping about the warranty... maybe you should have bought at least a 3 year one for a little over $20. As for me and mine... we will continue to enjoy our air fryer! Happy cooking!

reviews.reviewTitle: Had two units with faulty door interlock permissive...I'll explain
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this Power Air Fryer just before Christmas in 2018 and suddenly the door light would not turn off when closing it. This in turn prevented the unit from turning on. After manipulating the door I realized that if you lifted up on the door handle the light would go out and the unit could be operated. SO I started shoving thick place mats under the front bottom of the door essentially forcing the door up and then I could operate it. I decided to return the unit because frankly I liked it when it worked AND the same problem is now showing up with this unit. Both occurrences seemed to manifest itself after using it for 4-5 times so I'm thinking it is a heat related deformation causing the interlock on the door to not throw far enough to get the permissive. Obviously a design flaw AND possibly a big reason for the failures cited in other reviews. I hate to say it because I really do like this product when it works but they are definitely selling a poorly manufactured product without enough testing before going to market IMHO....

My wife gave me this item for Christmas. She had purchased it off another site with all the extras. It’s an impressive looking unit, nice touch screen display with shot cut keys etc. So I used it 3 times and to be honest I liked the way it cooked it makes really great wings! Anyway, when I went to use it the 4th time the unit would not turn on, power came on but it would not run. I went over it real well and found that the door was not closing properly i.e. it was hanging or should I say dropping down just a hair which would not allow the unit to turn on because the safety switch in the door would not engage. If I lifted up slightly on the door it would run. The door hinges are CHEAP junk poorly designed! I would guess for reading many of these reviews that may have been issue with most of the units failing to run....you cannot tell by eye the door looks perfectly fine! I was lucky that my wife got it for another site cause I know the 60 day warranty had run out but I raised holy you know what and they refunded her money. The guy who is selling these thing on TV should be called out for the junk he is pushing noting all the bad reviews just on this site alone. The engineers need to go back to the drawing board and do so fixin to their design so people stop getting ripped off.

I purchased this unit at Walmart. I was able to use it two times and it cooked decent. On the third attempt it fired up to cook and lasted about 45 seconds before the power totally shut off. Now the oven will not power up or work. Called their customer service to basically be told they don’t stand behind their product and won’t help me replace it. I’d steer clear from these jokers. I know I won’t ever buy another thing from anyone associated with them. Thanks for wasting my hard earned money, power air fryer.

I purchased this oven 2/2018 directly from the company. I even purchased the extended warranty. I love the oven and the versatility of it. Two weeks ago the fan stopped working and it started smoking. I called the company to see what to so for warranty. I was told to send it back and it be replaced. My invoice number was the RMA number. I didn't have a box so I took it to UPS to send back. I found out it would cost $68.00 to return the device. So I checked the USPS and it was going to be $54.00. I tried to email the company to see if they would provide a shipping label and the email came back. This was the email address on their website. I decided to just purchase a different brand oven for $89.00. It was not cost effective for me to return the device. You might want to take this into consideration before buying. I am posting this review on Amazon because they do sell them, but also because the company would not respond.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't always believe what you see.
reviews.reviewText:
I watched the show on TV and was so excited to order one I even had my son watch it again to show him how easy it would be to cook things again. However this is not the case and this is why I am giving it low stars. The add on TV showed making 3 racks of chicken, but what it didn't say was what all you had to do to get all that chicken. You have to turn them and rotate the racks to get even cooking. This to me is not easier than the regular air fryer I had.
It is so hard to make the hamburgers because you have to flip them and then rotate the racks and then all of the grease is dripping on the open door.
While the over all clean up is easier than regular pots and pans, having to do all the rotating of the racks is just disappointing and in a way misleading. They should tell you this during the show.
Do not buy this! I went through two units, both of them the fan only worked once! Worst purchase ever!

This is too small to be useful for families. Only 3 racks. Its says it comes with 5 in the parts list but you really can't fit more than 3 in there with food on them anyway. They are only about 8-9 inches wide so you can only make small/personal sized pizzas. It only makes enough food for one or two people at a time. The rotisserie is so weak it will stop working if you have more than 4 pounds of food or anything barely touches the drip tray. The pictures on the box show the machine holding much more than it actually can. The rotisserie is horrible for chicken. Even if you find a chicken small enough to fit in the thing and truss it tight, it will still burn the skin while leaving the inside undercooked. It is very difficult to clean. About half the machine is taken up by the heating element. For such a large heating element, they should just make a bigger oven and make it worth the space it takes up. As others have mentioned, the parts are cheap, the pan peels and the warranty is just long enough for this thing to break down after the 5-7 uses it will last you. Conceptually a good idea. I wish it was larger and better made.

reviews.reviewTitle: Shuts off during cooking and door doesn't know it is closed
reviews.reviewText:
First time we cooked frozen French fries, it ran the whole time. Next time it shut off 3 minutes early, next time 7 minutes early. Once it shut off, forget it. We don't know why and are concerned about trying fries again, or anything that needs to be cooked for about 20 minutes. Another time, we opened it just to put in a tray, when the door was closed, the light would not shut off, the machine would not turn on. We unplugged it. Now we think we know why it won't work. The door system is so bad that the machine thinks the door is open even when it has been closed firmly and several times to make sure. Now we are working on trying to get the door to understand that it is closed. We really do like the machine when we can use it.
In my original review I gave it 4 stars, but that was when we could use it. First review was: We have had this for a couple weeks. The first thing we noticed was the lack of a basic 'how to' cookbook for simple items. It does come with three cook books; maybe useful if you like those types of food. The trays often fall on one side or the other, because there is so little on the sides to hold the trays. It does a nice job of toasting bagels and cooking frozen French fries. We are also happy because it nicely reheats leftover food brought home from going out to dinner. No more soggy microwaved leftovers. You just get to figure out how long and what temp to reheat at.

I loved this oven until the thing started on fire! I cleaned it every time I used it so no reason for it burning up. Called the company and they just said it was the initial burn off.....I told them the fan was not working and it was smoking and burning. Do not recommend this product. What a waste of money! 3 months is all I got out of it!

Was excited to get this. My wife surprised me for Christmas. Never worked. I spent several hours reading the manual, searching the net and searching the product itself for a reset button, on/off switch or any other reason it would not power up at all. No display - nada... Bought from a local Big Box and they were offering a $20 gift card with purchase which they allowed us to keep. After seeing enough "No Power" complaints to sway me, I've decided to go with the Cuisinart Toaster/Air Fryer oven instead which I will order from Amazon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Horrible plastic smell that does NOT go away after use and washing!
reviews.reviewText: I really gave this product a chance. I actually bought it from another place, but I wanted to leave a review here because I knew it would be seen here more widely. I put it outside on the porch to run it for the first time to get that "new" smell that comes from the first use of appliances out. It smelled strongly of plastic. I let it cool and hand washed everything. After it dried, I tried three more cycles, and it continuously smelled of plastic. I think probably because the fan and heating element are encased above the oven space, so when it heats, it must be heating up the plastic. I'm not a scientist, so I don't know if chemicals are being distributed to the food, but it was enough of a turn off for me to return it and look for another type of air fryer. I did like that the trays were metal and not coated with non-stick coating as so many other reviews on the machines that are coated say that the coating flakes off.

I bought this fryer as a mother's day gift this year.. We used it maybe 8 times before the fan quit, but with a lousy 60 day warranty were too late to return it. Looks from other reviews as these fryers are not intended to last much more than 60 days. At this price would not recommend to anyone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only worked for 2.5 months, almost burned my house down!
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this air fryer for our family for Christmas (bought at Walmart for $119.00). We loved it! Used it at least 4-5 times per week, and it worked well. After 1 week the interior light stopped working, an annoyance, but the fryer still worked, so we continued to use it. In February, it started smelling like burnt plastic, so we stopped using it until my husband could look at it. One day in late February, my son plugged it in and it started spewing electrical sparks from underneath. I would have to reach over the unit to unplug it (likely lighting myself on fire) so i brushed it off the counter, knocking it to the floor and causing a dent in the plastic top. It unplugged and stopped spewing fire, but Walmart would not take it back because it was purchased November 20th (>90 days). I found an online return center from the PowerAirFryer company, but because we didn’t buy it directly from them, we were required to pay to send it back to them, and they would have 90 days to “decide on a reimbursement amount”. Since it had a dent now, i did not want to pay $30 for shipping to be told it was not covered.

Long-story-short: Do not buy this unit unless you don’t care if it only lasts 2-3 months or catches on fire. Good luck.

reviews.reviewTitle: It works good, but gets very hot so be very careful ...
reviews.reviewText: It works good, but gets very hot so be very careful removing food. Be sure to use it as much as possible in your first 60 days, because ours stopped working just out of the warranty period. Until then we used it for fries and onion rings, frozen chicken fingers etc. The food is very moist and crispy. We never got the rotisserie rod, but it's on back order.

reviews.reviewTitle: Foul tasting food! Not worth the plastic it is made from!
reviews.reviewText: We bought ours from a big box store. We did use it several times before we returned it. 1- never did cook evenly on the shelves, burnt on the top shelf, raw on the bottom shelf. 2- It gave our food a plastic/chemical type of flavor. The inside is plastic and I wonder if that could be what it was from. The idea is a great one, it is just the 2 of us but I will stick to my toaster oven, at least we know our food will taste the way it should. Not worth the plastic it is made from!

This is my first review on a product. But I'm incredibly disappointed with this product! We bough it for Christmas and just tried it for the FIRST TIME! When we plugged it in, the inside light came on and the power digital display came on but nothing else. We adjusted the trays, plugged it in again, adjusted the door and the display doesn't come on. We bought it from Kohl's and plan on returning it there but when I called Power Air Fryer customer service they said there's nothing they could do and we just have to return it to the store and it's up to the store to give us a refund or not. So either Kohl's has to absorb the cost or we do if Kohl's won't take it back. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: what exactly does this thing do?
reviews.reviewText: i just really dont get it. I bought it thinking it might "fry" or get a crispy exterior for frozen french fries. it takes about 40 minutes, and even then the fries just taste like cardboard. you are way better off using your oven. I tried chicken once, and that was a complete disaster. I am all for clean eating, but this product just does not make your food taste good. You are better off just steaming or grilling your food if you want to eat clean. Buy yourself a real fryer folks lol. waste of money.

I purchased this item online - not from amazon, but directly from their website. The first unit I received didn't work. I spoke to customer service and they offered to replace it. The second unit they sent worked ONCE. When it worked it was great, but after just one use, when plugged in, the control panel flashes, then turns off. The on/off button remains lit, but when pressed, nothing happens. They are going to replace it again, but I'm really sorry I ever started with these people. There is obviously a serious design flaw. It's useful that they are willing to replace the unit AGAIN, but I'm tired of lugging it back and forth to Federal Express. I would most definitely warn any potential buyers to look elsewhere. There are plenty of airfryers on the market that actually work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Odor and cooked well while it lasted
reviews.reviewText:
We bought this direct, and my wife also bought the 3 year coverage. It lasted just over 3 months. We used it on average once or maybe twice a week, and liked the results, however, there was an odor about the house whenever we used it. Then, last month.. it would not turn on. The dashboard lit up, the interior light came on, but it wouldn't do anything.
I called their support line, and they said to pack it up and send it back. 2 weeks later, they emailed my wife to tell her that they credited us back for our money. There was no repair, no replacement being done. Never again.. not worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent oven, could be better built.
reviews.reviewText: This had alot of potential to be great. However, after 15+ uses, it still stinks of a burning plastic weird smell when in use, and the racks seem as though they could fit a bit better. Kind of cheap. The top rack seems to cook much faster than the lower racks when I am using 2 or 3 of the racks at once. Aside from those 3 issues, I like this oven. Quick and easy for fries, lil pizzas, or other frozen apps and snacks. Nice to not have to turn on hot oven when I can use this. I haven't tried out any homeade recipes yet. I hope it lasts, we shall see.

I purchased this product from another company. As a sucker for all kinds of kitchen equipment I was so excited to try this product. I have a small kitchen and love the idea of equipment doing double duty. As an experienced cook I know the value in reading the manuals prior to setting up and using so I was careful to follow the manufacturers instructions in using for the first time. I was aware from other reviews that their could be an odor that needs to burn off. I wasn't prepared for the stench that came off this oven. It stuck up not only my small kitchen but my entire home. I opened all the windows in 40 degree weather but I swear it was so bad I still smelt it coming off the unplugged and repackaged machine a day later. Needless to say it went back. If you are even thinking about buying this machine prepare yourself for storing all the fiddly bits that come with it. You will need a big tub and a place to store it. Honestly...Just don't bother.

I have had this product for over 2 months now and I use it everyday. Grow up people, and take some personal responsibility for your inability to use this appliance correctly. I meal prep and this appliance works great. I use it daily to make 3-4 servings of chicken or fish. Both of those two pre-set functions work perfectly. I pull the meat straight out of the freezer, rub it with a little olive oil to get the seasonings to stick, hit the preset button, and come back to a delicious perfectly cooked protein. I have used the basket to cook shrimp. It did take longer than the setting, but it was my fault for stuffing the basket too full. I used the skewers to make rotisserie pork chops. There was definitely a learning curve with the skewers and the way they lock in. The rotisserie functionality took some trial and error to get everything figured out. After I got it figured out though, it worked like a champ. I also made beef jerky with it. Again it was my fault for not buying a thin enough cut of meat to make the jerky. It came out great but took twice as long because of the thickness of the meat not due to the functionality of the machine. Overall this appliance is by far the most valuable appliance in my kitchen. I love it so much, I am buying one for everyone in the family.

reviews.reviewTitle: Incredible machine but not built to last
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love my airfryer. It cooks almost anything and in half the time. I have cooked frozen cheese sticks, frozen chicken nuggets, jalapeño poppers, small frozen pizzas, frozen taquitos. I’ve even made cookies in it once. I make pork chops, steak, chicken, beef jerky, even prime rib. The rotisserie function made the best prime rib I’ve ever had in my life. This machine is truly incredible. However the is not built to last. I have only had mine for about a year and within the first 6 months, the door would just unlatch and stop cooking on it’s on. So I’ve been rigging it by placing things in the cracks under the door to keep the door latches. I would buy the bigger one if I knew it would last. It is perfect for making quick after school snacks for kid’s and dinners and everything. I absolutely love this airfryer, I just wish it was made better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Food cooks perfect! Takes trials to learn exact cooking times and temps
reviews.reviewText:
We’ve had our fryer for 2 weeks now. We’ve used it multiple times a day every day since we bought it. So far it has worked perfectly. No bad smells, no burning, everything seems to be working perfectly.
Food has come out absolutely stunning. We’ve made wings, rotisserie deboned-stuffed chicken, fish, vegetables , French fries, scrambled egg bake, hash browns, garlic bread, even made a chocolate cake which turned out perfect! I haven’t used my oven since we got this.
I will say, I refused to buy this from the tv advertisement. I am so paranoid of them.
The one we bought was on sale at our local BB&B and we used out 20% off code, so it cost under $100. I thought the sales person told me it has a one year warranty but I’m not worried because if it does break-I know BBB has a great return policy. My suggestion is get it from a local store where you can return it if it does go bad; but it is definitely worth trying. I absolutely love mine!!!
Now I’m just here looking for some other accessories besides what it came with.

I bought my first unit in July 2018, absolutely loved it. I teach cooking to adults, recommended this unit to them. But after 3 months, the paint blistered on the drip tray. Took it back to Bed Bath and Beyond and they immediately gave me a whole new unit....just wanted the drip tray replaced but they said it had to be a whole new unit. This is unit doesn't work well, the temp keeps losing degrees...now when set at 400, the oven thermometer says 350, down another 25 degrees from the last couple of uses. Nothing is crisping, takes longer to cook and comes out oven baked. Will see if BBB will take this unit back which I have had for only 2 months. Wish I had kept my first unit and just ignored the blistered drip tray

Enough space to cook a full meal for 2 or one entree for 4. It cooked very fast and didn't heat up the house like the oven. It was really fun to cook with...until the third week when it started beeping, shut off, and never turned back on.

Where the hell did the good reviews go that amazon calculated to make 4 stars overall?? From reading the reviews this product SUCKS! I can’t believe anyone would risk buying this after reading the first 10 reviews.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buyer Beware! Will not work more than a few months. Warranty 30 days.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this oven 5 months ago, and tonight it just stopped working. I followed every direction, and took very good care of it. There was no reason for it's failure. No way to fix it, and Power Air will not exchange or refund money. Most people that are giving good reviews have not had the machine that long. It works great until it doesn't turn on at all. BIG waste of money. I didn't see the reviews until after I had ordered it directly from the manufacturer. Heed the warnings.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's what they don't tell you that hurts!
reviews.reviewText:
The drip tray is way too shallow and the cooking spatter that comes off the fatty foods during cooking runs down the interior walls and run under the drip pan and after a while it runs out of the cooker and onto your counter.
I sent The fryer back under their 60 day return policy. That wasn't a problem until UPS charged $71.00 for the return. They said the cost was do to the distance from Albuquerque nm to CT.

reviews.reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY IT DOESN'T WORK FOR LONG i only got 5 Mo. for my $150
reviews.reviewText: I bought this airfyer in November 2018 and it broke this May. the warranty is only good for 60 days and you have to pay to send it back to them so they know they are selling you something that doesn't work. Don't waste you money on this. it was great when it worked but for $150 you expect it to work for at least the year. I purchase this from their website.

I only used the air fryer twice. The first time I wanted to try something simple. I filled the basket according to the directions with some frozen fries. The book stated to cook between 16-18 minutes. After the specified time they were not fully cooked, so I just chalked this up to a difference in individual fryers and just added 3 more min. They were almost done. The next attempt was a rotisserie chicken. Putting the chicken on the rotisserie was a royal pain. Then when I loaded it into the fryer, I found out the center piece is too short. When attempting to engage the drive on the left side, the right side will fall out of the track. If I just barely engage the drive on the left the rotisserie will slip out of the drive end after about 30-40 seconds. I finally gave up and cooked my chicken in the oven. It will be going back to the store tomorrow (not purchased through Amazon). I would not recommend anyone wasting their time or money on this fryer.

DO NOT BUY! This worked great until it stopped working. They do NOT stand by their money back guarantee. They will not provide documentation for your return authorization nor will they give you a refund. I was told to take it to the place i purchased it almost two months ago to get my money back they will only replace it with another air fryer that will likely stop working in 50 days. Listen to the reviews. I thought i would try it despite the reviews but it didnt work out. The door prevents the unit from continuing to work properly. I am not sure why. You have to keep closing it multiple times to get it to work, then the light comes on and it will not start. No i didnt break the door or damage the product in any way. It has its own power outlet and its not overloaded.

We bought one of these air fryer's and it shorted out immediately. Sparks and all, sent it back. My husband bought one on sale called the company and wanted our money back that we sent back still waiting on that. The new one he boughta also doesn't work. You can not push the buttoms half the time it doesn't turn on. Please do not buy the air fryer with the shelves not worth the problems

Pros; the rotisserie is great! The basket is a really good tool for fries, nuggets anything small, and seriously it’s fun to watch it turn! The removal tool works great with the rotisserie & the racks.
Cons: there is a smell the first couple of times but most things do have the new smell. Also the drip pan paint did peel after it got some burnt juices on it but that isn’t reall an issue for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loved it when I first got it - issues with rotisserie - Defective Product
reviews.reviewText: Loved this when I first got it. Having issues with the rotisserie as the weight needs to be perfectly balanced to be able to turn. Drive motor does not seem to be able to handle a whole chicken. Tried to put 2 cornish hens on the shaft, not enough room for 2. Tried just 1 at a time, and again, could not turn all the way around. I purchased the 6 Year Protection Plan and found out they no longer carry the "elite" oven and want to downgrade me to the regular oven. Apparently, the 6 year Protection Plan is for replacement only (although they cannot provide me with a copy of it). Purchase an air fryer from a reputable manufacturer and steer clear of this one.

I bought mine directly from their website. I'm commenting here so others can be warned. I've owned mine for about 3 months. My 5th time using it the inner glass exploded. I was making the grandkids a snack of pizza bites. I was just starting to love this giant appliance. Then boom! Thank God the outter plastic didn't explode too! My daughter was standing right in front of it!
This is way too expensive to gamble on and way too dangerous! Please don't buy this.
The fan quit working after 3 days of use. Returned to store (bought at Bed, bath, and beyond). do not recommend.

The practice of air frying your food is undeniably an excellent way to cook. This one did a great job while it lasted and I will definitely purchase another fryer but from some other company. This fryer lasted just over 3 months at which point i received an E2 error code. I contacted the company as directed in the manual and was told I had to buy another unit. For the money, it should last more than just three months. Look else where.
This oven seems great, but is only $160 direst on tv

Ugh. Smells like a plastic factory in here. I should
know, my dad had a plastic extrusion factory. Tastes like plastic. Ugggh. How did they get away with this?

This is a recent view and the product received did not power on. What a scammer product. The inside of the oven is made of plastic! It's not just cheap but an idiotic product. It was probably not design for rotisserie but they push out the flaw product anyway.

First two times used this product; no problem. third time noticed after adjusting racks, the door seemed to latch properly but the power would not come on. After checking power source and making sure it wasn't over heating, I adjusted the door and power came back on. The fourth time the only way it would run was to wedge the door in and up so it would power on. I had this for only 2 weeks warranty said I had to mail it back for refund (I don't want replacement) It cost over $50 to mail it back. My husband just told me a coworker bought one and her's is doing the same thing. Wouldn't buy it.

I purchased this elsewhere. That said, this is an extremely useful and a true multitasker. I live alone and you can do a whole lot of different tasks with this. I also have the large Breville multi oven, and this is a perfect companion. And it has a rotisserie! For small portions. Very hard to find and this works great. If a compact multi talker is what you need (think apartment or vacation home) this is the one one that gives a lot of bang for the buck!

Just purchased this product. The previous reviews are correct everything sticks. I did not get a deep fryer basket . I suppose I can order this not sure. I am not pleased with this product and sure wish I had purchased a single air fryer. I do not recommend this product. The foods I have placed on the racks they do not brown to sanctification. I am disappointment with this purchase. I paid way too much money for a not so great product and yes it reminds me of Easy Bake oven:(

reviews.reviewTitle: Loved it for 1 year and 6 months...
reviews.reviewText: I loved cooking with this - fries, fish, pork chops and more were amazing, and the kids couldn't get enough of the wings we'd make. I had the 5 trays and even dehydrated beef to make great jerky. The problem with the unit is that you have to re-position the trays if you are using more than one tray (it is hotter on top and things don't cook as well on the bottom). The other issue is that mine just died. Ordered it December 2017 and broke yesterday for a total useful life of 1 year and just under 6 months. The fan stopped working and it's going in the garbage tonight.

I bought mine at a retail store,worked great and I loved using it. First thing that went wrong was it would keep running even after opening the door,then it finely just stopped working,by then the warranty was up. I tried to email them several times and got no response.
I would hope they would stand behind their products if they believed they were worth it!!!! VERY DISAPPOINTED
Not happy with the product, too small and I was not pleased with the way the recipes turned out. I tried several features on and it’s not practical.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product but for a limited time
reviews.reviewText: I liked how it cooked the food and I made a wide variety with it. Unfortunately it broke down after 10 months which seems to be longer than other people as there reviews say it only lasted a few days up to a couple months. And they said customer service wasn't helpful. I had the same experience he said we could send it back but had to pay shipping also he needed the receipt which I no longer have because 10 months past I never knew I would need it. We figured to save our 55 dollars on shipping to invest in a knew product with better reviews.

Received as a Christmas gift and used regularly for over a week and then noticed a buildup of grease in the door. It is inside the window panes as I have thoroughly cleaned unit after each use. Disappointed in quality of product. Contacted company directly to see if could get a door replacement and they didn’t help. If you use all three racks only the food on top gets done, have to rotate the racks! As you can see if n the pictures the grease is not on the outside of the door but inside the door so can’t clean.

I got this product as a gift for christmas, i used it a total of 2 times and it worked great till the 3rd time then the machine just stopped working, i called to get troubleshooting help because of course the 60 day warranty had expired since it was bought in Oct and was not given to me until christmas. They offered no resolution to the problem. They have no sort of support team to help you try to fix it, they will not send replacement if out of warranty, basically they took the $159 and sold a piece of crap in a box that works one maybe 2 times, and didn't care, I never even got the chance to open and use any of the accessories that came with it.

I recently purchased this unit for my husband for Christmas thinking it would be easy for him to prepare a meal. This was not the case. It took over 2 hours to make chicken fingers and French fries for a family of 4. The clean up was more than two baking sheets in the regular oven would have been. We had an issue every time we tried to put the rotating basket it. I moved the unit to cool off and when I wiped off my counter the hot dish water steamed off the counter top. I am hoping it doesn't bubble up when it cools down. I am hoping we experience greater ease the next time. The one good thing though I was able to purchase the unit at our local WalMart store for about $45 less than the on TV price.

First if you cook with 2 racks the one on top will get real brown before the second rack. The racks are so hard to clean especially if you make the cheese sticks and the cheese melts out of the stick. The french fries take twice as long as it recommends the basket is hard to get in until you get it figured out. The dehydrator takes days for do jerky maybe not that long but a day and a night and it still didn't dry it good. I have found more bad than good with this oven. If I had of kept my box it came in I'd have shipped it back before the 30 days was up. I read it cost 80 dollars to send back don't know if its true or not. Just keep your money in your pocket and don't waste it on this oven.

reviews.reviewTitle: A terrible device. Rotisserie won’t work
reviews.reviewText: A terrible device. Rotisserie won’t work. You should be able to put food in, press one button, and done. Nope. Do not buy!

I bought this and used it one time. I went to use it again and the power switch on and off would not work. The menu would not turn on and work. All the accessories are thin and flimsy Poor quality stuff. Do not waste your money on this.

When frying chicken, the top rack cooks better than the rest when you have more than one rack in it.. Also, I believe the "wire meshes need to be made out of a nonstick product. They are hard to clean, needs to be soaked. Needs better instructions for the "rotisserie, how to place on rotisserie shaft and line up the "hole" for the shaft. Can be a lil messy. We originally had the cooks essential from QVC and loved it.

Update: Rotisserie chicken came out good! In my opinion, there are too many pieces to lose, like lil screws for the rotisserie shaft, which are also kinda hard to line up. It does to many things, when you just wanna air fry food for healthy options...
One word...JUNK. Very disappointed. Don’t waste your time reasesching or your money.

The air fryer functions are somewhat ok. One of the reasons I chose this model was the dehydrator feature. However, for most of the recipes in the recipe book included, the instructions say to set the temperature at 125F and cook for 6 hours. First of all, the lowest temperature that the oven will go is 150F and the longest time for the timer is 1 hour. So, something is amiss. Also, I tried to use the rotisserie basket and followed instructions for putting it into place. It was a difficult maneuver and then did not rotate. I will be returning the oven.

These reviews are from different machines. They do not even come with some of the parts people had issues with. Someone said they could not even open it up without a cord ! This has absolutely nothing to do with it. The door will open for you at anytime plugged in or not.

reviews.reviewTitle: Find one with a year plus warranty
reviews.reviewText: It worked great at first after 3 months it went kaput . I barley used it but when I did it was for the kids frozen nuggets fries etc... 60 day warranty only a waste of money don’t buy it . I thought it would last me years to come .

BUYER BEWARE - The product comes with a 60 day warranty but stopped working at 90 days. The touchscreen and power button have stopped working. They want me to ship it back (on my dime) and send a replacement. Why would I want a second one of the first one was poor quality? I’m now stuck with a useless air fryer. Ugh!
It was great when it worked. After only a few months and minimal use, the power buttons started malfunctioning and then the entire thing stopped working. Piece of junk! Do not purchase!

The covering of the drip pan has come off and it is now beginning to rust. Have coated it and the racks with spray so as to avoid sticking and have hand washed the pieces. The unit is easy to clean except for the rack holders vs my big fingers. Food times need adjustment but I have mastered the art of watching the food and checking for doneness. I would imagine that many people have issues but I have had no problems except for the pan issue.

This fryer is a piece of junk. Quit working after about 8-10 uses. Plug it in and just blinks and beeps. Called customer service and they said “yes, the unit is bad, stop using it”. Then proceed to tell me that I have to pay to send it in. But that will do no good, because it is out of warranty. But if I pay to send it back then they MAY be able to repair it for a price.
DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worst Air fryer on the market
reviews.reviewText: Beware, air fryer broke less than a week. I would not recommend this brand. It’s cheaply made. Their warranty is also bad. Trust me! Do not get this air fryer!

reviews.reviewTitle: Be aware of all the bad reviews, they are true
reviews.reviewText: If I could give zero stars I would......after only having this item for 2 months it will not blow any heat at all. Very disappointed and wouldn't recommend this cheaply made item to my worst enemy. Customer service is awful with only replying they are sorry for any inconvenience. They will expect you to pay shipping to send it back in to be fixed but is it really worth it......nope.

This needs more one star ratings. Good concept poor execution. The entire inside is made of plastic and the only metal parts are what you put the food on so the food tastes like plastic. I should've just closed the box back up when the first thing I saw was a paper that basically said by using this you waive the ability to have a class action lawsuit... what are you afraid of?

I ordered my power air fryer off the TV commercial and I’ve had it for approximately eight months use it practically every night and I love it No problems whatsoever with it and have recommended it to several friends and family and several of them have bought one also

reviews.reviewTitle: Unit stopped work in lest then one month. Not a good buy !!
reviews.reviewText: This unit seem to be failing for everyone. Read reviews from other people before purchase. Like those other reviews we used this 5 to 6 times. And unplugged it after every use. Went to use again plugged it in. Guess what no power no light nothing. Even tried a different plug for the hell of it. Nothing totally dead !! Bought the extended warranty because of the reviews I read. We had this for 1 mouth so didn’t really need the extended warranty. Returned it for full refund. It worked great and cooked very well for the 5 to 6 times it was used. It would be in your best interest to buy a different brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Continues to smell like burning plastic
reviews.reviewText: So far in the two months we have had this, everything we have tried hasn’t been so good. The smell of plastic is nauseating even after about ten uses!
The fan quit shortly after the 60 day warranty expired. Now I know why they have such a short warranty. They are useless garbage. Run away and don't waste your money on this POS!!!!

This thing is poorly built for being so expensive. Mine only lasted for about a dozen uses before it quit working. The unit powers up and does nothing else. I had been using a NuWave air fryer for several years without a single problem and I thought I was "upgrading" with this unit only to be disappointed. Unless you enjoy wasting money, stay away from this one.

I haven't had mine that long but I've cooked crispy chicken wings from raw and I've also cooked boneless, skinless chicken breast and both times I had a beautiful crispy product. I don't use wet batter though but I didn't with my last air fryer either. I season meat, toss it in my dry chicken batter and spray with olive oil to get it wet all over and cook for 35 - 40 minutes on 400. I rotate the trays approximately every 10 minutes and spray a little more cooking spray each time. They came out perfect. Tonight I'm doing bone-in breast and some time this week I plan to try the rotisserie. Hope I can make it that far!

I received the Power Air Fryer Oven as a gift. Was very excited, until it stopped working. Only used it four times, and now it won’t power on or do anything. The concept was great, but manufacturing of this product is horrible.
Bad company to work with. Door would not close properly and handle broke. Company would not return messages.

The drip pan is cheap and the coating falls when washing it in the sink not even in the dishwasher, and then gets rusty, BUT worst of all, mine started giving me trouble not staying on and then one day it just wouldn't come on at all. Called the customer service phone line and I have to send it back at my expense which will be about $55 to return it and MAYBE they will replace it. Not sure it is worth it. The smaller Air Fryer basket is a lot cheaper in price and would work just as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product, near constant use and no issues.
reviews.reviewText:
We have this one. Tbh I’ve never used it, but my husband runs it literally 50% of the time, night and day. He dehydrates everything - coffee grains, leftover food, peels from produce, etc, to use to fertilize our yard. Basically compost. Then we use it for food also here and there. Everything we cook has turned out great.

My only complaint is the lack of option to adjust the volume on the alarm. It is ridiculously loud and sounds any time it is finished unless you unplug it.

The thing is running like a champ with zero issue after 6 months.

When I purchased this appliance I absolutely LOVED IT! Problem is, it only lasted for 3 months and then quit working all together. I believe the warranty was for 60 days. I bought it from Walmart and had to fight to return it. My advice is to keep searching, this is not the one.

for those of you struggling with the plastic smell...Trust me put vinegar and lemon juice in a oven safe bowl run on 370-400 degrees for 10 minutes, do a few times if needed. Then put just water in the bowl run for 10 minutes or more and the smell goes away guys. I was frustrated too but this works!!!! It works awesome great product!
Can't find anything on how to dehydrate. I googled & you tube, nothing.even checked the little book that came with it. This was a Christmas gift. Still in box. Going to try to send back

Unit worked 1 time, after that control panel will not work. Power is on with light working but power panel is not lit up and will not work. I followed all the instructions regarding cool down and turning the unit off. I would not recommend this appliance to anyone. Warranty is also useless.

The produce is an overhyped fade that will windup in the garage or basement storage space. I didn't find the flavor as exciting as the promotional hype, their slow, cheaply made and cumbersome to use. I like my oven cooked or slow cooker meals best! Thumbs down on this one!

Enjoy the product. It is sad that to sell them they scam you. Offer said there were food coupons to use, there are none. There is info that suggests if you spend a couple of days worth of time on the net you can somehow get something but who has that kind of time. Very disappointing to be lied to.
Mine worked for three minutes. Must have some kind of in line fuse that blows. No power. Didn’t even get to eat my first thing I cooked in it. French Fries.
broke at the 61 day mark after receiving it as a gift. warranty only last for 60 days. light on the inside of it never worked. it will turn on and heat up but will not circulate air
Worked once. Then nothing but a power button. Customer service confirmed that I must have a lemon. Told to take it back. No problem. Lousy product. Lousy technology. Call me when you have it right.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cooks ok but the chemical smell is overwhelming...save yr money
reviews.reviewText: This oven is almost entirely plastic. It cooks things ok but the plastic chemical smell is overwhelming to me. I don't see this being very healthy for anyone and it really doesn't do anything a regular oven cant. Save your money....

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked one time.... that's it.... once
reviews.reviewText: I turned it on once to burn off the residual oil like the manual says. A few hrs later I actually went to use it for the first time and it didnt work. When you first power it on every light goes on and then immediately shuts off. Dont buy this product.
Its a great product if you want to toss it a couple days later.

reviews.reviewTitle: Throw your money in the street...
reviews.reviewText: ...at least someone might have the chance of finding it and using it for something useful. Thankfully, this was a gift, so I didn't lose money on the deal, but just like so many other reviews on here, mine quit working right at 4 months time. Those are pretty terrible odds. Do NOT waste your money on this cheap product and it 60-day warrantee. 60 days? That's a joke.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love ❤️ my 6 and 8 quart power oven air fryers!
reviews.reviewText: Makes the perfect grilled cheese sandwiches and fried chicken!
Can't cook anything for more than 15 minutes without it overheating and the door opening, had to prop the door up to finish cooking food. Seems as if it could so hot it may catch fire.

I bought this product set the TV commercial. I mostly wanted it for the rotisserie which was extremely hard to use and then broke. I ended up cooking the turkey breast in the basket. I returned it but I’m still waiting for my money to be refunded.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just made a rotisserie turkey breast and it came out ...
reviews.reviewText: Just made a rotisserie turkey breast and it came out delicious. Had no trouble mounting the rotisserie and just followed the directions. I will be using this oven for a lot of my cooking.

THE HANDLE AND SOME PIECES INSIDE THE UNIT ARE PLASTIC WHICH AS YOU KNOW THAT THIS UNIT COOKS AT
400 DEGREES FOR 40 MINUTES AT TIMES SO IT GETS VERY HOT AND THE PARTS ARE BREAKING/FALLING OFF
THE HANDLE IS VERY FLIMSY AND DOE NOT STAY ATTACHED WHICH MAKES IT HARD TO OPEN THE OVEN. FOR THE
AMOUNT OF MONEY THIS COST THEY SHOULD PUT MORE DURABLE PARTS TO THIS MACHINE
This fryer is junk! Bought for a mother's day gift and did not get one use out of it before it stoped working and put an error code on the readout. Do not buy! Real disappointment!

reviews.reviewTitle: I cannot recommend this product. In fact, don’t buy it!
reviews.reviewText: Product worked as advertised, but it died in less than a year. The warrantee is only 60 days and the company would do nothing about its early death.

This product was amazing while it lasted. 4 months after purchasing the product just stopped working and wouldn't turn on. Called the customer service to see if there was anything trouble shooting I could do and they were not helpful at all. Basically said I have had it for over 60 days and it is no longer their problem. Such a shame considering how well it worked when it wasn't broke.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t buy this piece of junk!
reviews.reviewText: Used 5 times now it shut off not working,but when it did work food took twice the time my oven did . It’s going into the trash and I’m bringing my toaster oven back

reviews.reviewTitle: Didn't last very long at all
reviews.reviewText:
I loved this air fryer until it stopped working(lights flash when I turn it on)
Didn't even use it 10 times!
60 day warranty makes you wonder about their product, sad!
Used it twice and the glass exploded.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does an awesome job. Just wish it was a bit bigger
reviews.reviewText: I use it all the time for 3.5lb chicken and Pork tenderloin and I can't get over how easy it is and how well it works. Best tenderloin I've made in quite a while. I wish it was just a bit bigger. A 4lb bird does not work. Also, the drip try appears to be peeling from some of the hot drippings.

It quit...a cheap little toaster oven will last longer.....
It did cook well. But appliances should last longer.
The fryer oven gets ...ZERO stars for longevity.

Only worked a handful of times. After that display would light, but couldn’t operate the display. Weren’t able to push any buttons. Warranty was a limited 60 days. Customer service at Air Fryer said there was nothing they could do. Besides that, not sure how it’s any better than an oven.

I bought this oven in July. Used it beginning this month for a family gathering. We noticed the bacon wasn't cooking at all on a temp of 350F. It was blowing air...no heat. I am so pissed! Buy from the real manufacturer... these are a rip off!!!!
This air fryer stopped working, poor quality do not buy, if you did save receipt and box, good luck with this air fryer!!
One use and have to bring it back it stopped working

I received this as a gift. I used it once to make sweet potato fries and then it stopped working. The power comes on but the display does not. I called the customer service number and their response was that I pay for the return of the product with a proof of purchase. Awful product and awful service.

Mostly, what I saw on the infomercials was true. I enjoyed using the air fryer until one day it simply quit working. Of course, after eight months, there is no warranty in effect and no help from customer service. For the price, I would not recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Product broke with less than a week usage
reviews.reviewText: Heating element broke in less than a week. Now we have a big, bulky item sitting on our counter top waiting to ship back.

The racks are difficlult to remove unless you have special oven mits, the rotisserie is very difficult and complicated to maneuver, no where on line can you find operation manuals for specific instructions. Poor choice of purchase. Too many say it is no longer operable after several uses.
This SUCKS! wings are crappy, takes WAY TOO LONG! Finished product is NOT GOOD
The unit turns off in middle of cooking. How do I get my money back? Very disappointed
Bought this product at belk and inmediately had problems. The door sensor just will not let my unit stay on. It needs to be reset once every minute. Makes the unit unusable.

I loved it and it cooked all my food perfectly for the first 10 uses then I went to us it and plugged it in and when I hit the power button nothing happened. I tried troubleshooting, emailing and tried live chat with the company and got no response. So disappointed

it was too large for my space, requires a single electric line to operaste, could not return without pating the shipping!!!!!
Order fron amazon if you truly want to try this. wish I had never seen the ad on tv
Worked good for the first 2 months then stops working. Wish I read reviews here before getting this pos. Back to my smaller one until they honor their pos 60 day warranty.
I bought a Power Air Fryer XL, and after 4 months the drain pan started leaking. It only has a two month warranty, so buyer beware,

The catch pan holds very little liquid, had to empty between rounds of chicken. The rotisserie quit working on the first use after about 15 minutes using the basket to cook frozen fries. Taking it back today!
Bought so i could use the rotisserie what a pain in the butt i hate it looking into something else!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t use Oven Cleaner on any of the parts of the Fryer, especially the basket!
reviews.reviewText: I really like the product but my husband didn’t read the instructions. My basket for my Power XL Fryer is ruined because he used Oven Cleaner on it. Where can I purchase another basket?

reviews.reviewTitle: Still trying to figure it out Had it for six months
reviews.reviewText:
It takes longer to cook that it report does
I don't have a dishwashing. - it is a challenge to clean
Can't cook using all the racks at once or does cook all.of it
Works very good, but the dain pan paint is already peeling after the first use.
I only got to use it 6 times before it just stopped working after the last meal. The oven when plugged up turned on but didn't stay on, none of the lights stayed on. Waste of money...
Quit working after 1 use. What a waste of money!!
We love it ..it is definitely worth the money
Made some poppers did a great job. Then the touch screen went out. Returned it. Recieved the new one. After first use same issue. Went dead.
Loved it while it worked, figured we just got a lemon, bought another one . Lasted eight months. We are going to miss it. Twice is enough.

reviews.reviewTitle: Garbage, no meals yet cooked because garbage front door will not close properly
reviews.reviewText: Does not work, not happy
rotisserie don't work POS

reviews.reviewTitle: easy to use, great flavor, but it wont work for long!!!
reviews.reviewText: what a piece of junk!!! it worked good for the 3 mth's it actually worked. best not to waste your money
Great until it just stopped working. Went completely dark after 9 months. Don't waste your money!
Junk do not buy, fan went out after a year of hardly being used. Customer service said sorry can't help you

reviews.reviewText:

Let's start by saying, that the company web site was not responding when I tried to buy so I thought I would try Amazon, and not only completed my purchase with one click but it was also eight dollars cheaper.
Upon arrival I plugged it in, batter dipped three drumsticks, put on a rack in the oven, and hit the picture of the drumstick. Forty minutes later they were perfectly cooked. Do keep in mind that cooking in this oven will take longer than conventional frying, but that is the compromise for fat free cooking.
I next used it to toast a hamburger bun, which was evenly toasted in under four minutes. Please note in my example i did not go to the instructions yet. I purchased this item for my country home in particular for the dehydrator feature, and look forward to try that in the near futre, although by then I will probably review the cookbooks that were included.

If I used rotisseries cooking chicken the size of chicken should be very small otherwise there's no space for rolling over. Also, product quality requires improvements. reviews.reviewTitle: You might make a better choice
reviews.reviewText: Bought mine on Oct. 28. The 6 qt Power Fry Oven.. Today, Thanksgiving, it won't operate at all. Shuts off a second after you plug it in. It has a switch on the door so it can't operate with door open. That switch is broken after less than 30 days and being used about 5 times. It's going back tomorrow!!! Do I want another one? Yes but not this brand! The switch is at the top of the door where it takes the brunt of pressure when you close it. Should of been placed at the bottom of door where it would be gently pushed closed. Poor design. I'll make a better choice

I saw the infomercial for this air fryer oven on TV, and being addicted to new gadgets, naturally, I just had to have one. I have one of the earlier model air fryers and have been very satisfied with it, but was impressed by this models features. The first thing I found out after getting it is that the rack height is very important for the cooking times set. After a little trial and error, however, it's not difficult to figure out. This thing is excellent for frying steaks and porkchops. Juicy and tender. The best thing I found with this unit is making french fries in the rotating basket. Walmart sells frozen french fries called "fast food french fries". Made in this basket they come out very close to McDonald's fries. Crispy on the outside and tender inside. I've not tried that dehydrator or the rotisserie yet, but I plan on making some jerky. It's also great for frozen small pizza.

My only negative comment would be that it makes a mess to clean up, but I guess that's to be expected.

reviews.reviewTitle: This Product has Lowered My Electric Bills by a Third!
reviews.reviewText:
I simply LOVE this product. I cook EVERYTHING in it. Almost anything I would cook in my oven, I can cook in the Air Fryer in 1/2 the time.
I cooked biscuits this morning and tested cooking 1/2 in a pre-heated oven and 1/2 in the Fryer and the Fryer cooked in 1/2 the time and didn't heat up the kitchen like the oven does. I've also noticed that my electric bills have been substantially lower since my purchase of the item as I never use my oven anymore.
It cooks the best chicken wings and fried chicken without the extra grease. I skin the chicken and flour with seasoned flour, mist it lightly with corn oil or olive oil and Voila! Perfect Fried Chicken in about 15-20 minutes. I love the trays so I can cook more at one time. It also cooks amazing Artisian like pizza that tastes like it came out of a pizza oven. Great Buy..........Would highly recommend.

We used it for 3 months before the display would light up and then disappear making it totally unresponsive. We were telling everyone how great it was but needed to recant if it lasts only a few months. This was our the second Power Air Fryer, we were going to give the smaller one to our son, but it went out just when we bought this one. It lasted less than six months. No more Power Air-Fryers for us. We will look for another brand and really check for ratings on reliability.

UPDATE: Had to get a refund. Lasted roughly two months. The door sensor gave in. So disappointed, I really liked this air fryer.

I love this product, although can’t give 5 stars. I bought it cause a friend recommended it. I had an air fryer before but the bowl type, and almost didn’t use it cause I didn’t find it was practical. I love this one cause it’s like a mini oven and I can actually look at whatever’s inside cooking cause of the glass door and the light, SUPER PRACTICAL! Plus, it fits a lot more than the bowl type. It’s easy to use, super easy to clean cause the door is detachable, and you can cook literally anything in there.

ISSUE: I read some reviews before buying about technical issues and the thing not working after a few uses. Mine still works after about a month, and been using it almost everyday. BUT, sometimes it won’t turn on because when I put the door back on it doesn’t detect it, and I have to take it off and put it back on a few times for it to work. Hope it doesn’t stop working altogether because I really love it.

I did not purchase through Amazon (bought at Walmart). I wanted to replace my Nuwave 10Qt. The design looked better and space utilization looked more efficient. And these held true. In fact, the design is pretty user friendly, air racks plentiful, and capacity is great. HOWEVER, I wanted to note 2 items just to provide some additional information about his unit.

--> SMELL. This unit had an electrical/plastic burning smell, and no matter how long I baked empty at 400F to burn it out, it didn't. Others noted this as well. Not sure how many units had this, but mine and several others had this.
--> HEAT on bottom. I measured the heat on the base to be >200F (hot air exiting the unit), blowing on the counter (now I understand why someone said their Corian had cracked!), and the sides are at <measured> ~150F (too hot to touch and move until it cools down).

These factors should be stated with high warning marks in any documentation, but I didn't see something that would provide an good enough, and emphatic warning about the heat because anything over 110-120F might cause some burn (or how to get rid of that smell).

Also, I presume the 8QT design is the same. And finally, there appears to be an updated version (On Amazon) Power 'Elite', which may have cured these issues.
