Doesn’t cook as well or as quick as the smaller ones.

We bought this unit directly from the merchant online. We used it a few times and it worked fine. A couple days ago, we tried to cook some frozen french fries but they weren't cooking. It was as if the unit was only on very low heat. We attempted to complete the cook a couple more times, but no go. We contacted the manufacture via email they publish on their website. They responded within a sort period of time, explaining that we were beyond the 60 day warranty period. We attempted to get them to give us an option for repair or whatever, but the only response we got was: "We really do apologize for the inconvenience. However, we can no longer process a replacement since your order was outside the 60 days warranty."

The bottom line is: we're screwed. Beware!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great appliance! Just have to experiment with it.
reviews.reviewText: Honestly, at first the burning plastic smell and taste that others complained about really disappointed me and I was ready to return it. However, I figured I would give it a week or so to see if the odor and taste would disappear. I researched online and did wipe down the inside with some vinegar and lemon and let it run at 400 for about 30 minutes. I repeated the same the next day. I also left it stored with the glass door open while trying to get rid of the smell. Thankfully, the odor and taste finally disappeared and it was all love from there! This is a great little appliance and so versatile! I’ve cooked meat, vegetables, corn on the cob, etc and everything turns out perfectly! It holds a really good amount of food and I just love having the rotisserie. I would definitely recommend but remind everyone that you are going to have to wait out the plastic smell for about 6 or 7 uses. Also, non-stick spray works perfectly on the cooking racks and rotisserie basket. No sticking at all.

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought this for my wife's birthday from Samclub, ...
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this for my wife's birthday from Samclub, she used it the same day. The very next morning went to turn it on with the touch screen blue button on the bottom middle and nothing! would not turn on no matter how many times pressed or unplugged and plugged back in to reset.
Exchanged it at Sam's brought back home, she then cooked french fries in the rotisserie drum,it It got so hot you barely could touch the sides, and there was a oder of hot plastic in the food also. We will be returning item.

reviews.reviewTitle: I prefer the regular Power Airfryer to this "oven-style" one ...
reviews.reviewText: I just don't think the air flows as powerfully in this unit. Regardless, after this thing went "belly up" (just black screen, wouldn't turn on) after 90 days (only used it maybe a dozen times), I noticed it only has a 60-day warranty! If you're going to take a chance on the Power Airfryer Oven, seek out a merchant (you have a 20% chance of choosing the right one - hint/wink) that has a virtually unlimited return policy - you very well may need it!

Purchased elsewhere. Had it for about 2 weeks first use tonight. Made frozen french fries took longer than my regular oven, 35-40 min air fryer vs 18-22 min for regular oven. There was an absolutely horrible odor like burning chemicals or plastic, However for this use the fries tasted OK. I have about a week to send it back to that shopping channel and I will do so if it continues to have that odor, If so I will also change the stars to one!.
I buy a lot of the stuff Chef Theiss advertises, This is the first time I have been disappointed.

I have an 8qt pressure cooker from this same company that I love so much I bought a second one so I bought this air fryer thinking I'd love it too. I just took it out of the box and didn't even bother to cook with it. After reading several reviews about the drip pan flaking paint, I can see how that would happen. The coating seems poor quality but I figured I could get around that by just using a piece of foil (which would be my recommendation if you DO purchase this).

My biggest complaint and the reason I put this all right back in the box is that besides the trays, grabber tool, skewers (and parts to use them), and rotating basket, this is so much cheap plastic I question how long it would last. The door literally falls off when you try to open it. I assume it was designed this way so you can clean it but it's not a good design at all. The slots that hold the racks are plastic. The instructions say to use the grabber tool to remove items while hot. I just cannot fathom how this flimsy tool is sufficient enough to remove any of the accessories WITH food on them without causing the potential for complete disaster.

I wanted to love this thing, really, but I just couldn't get over how cheap it feels. Now having read more reviews, I see that I'm not the only one with the opinions I have. This is going back and I'll research air fryers a little more.
Bought this at Walmart for $139!!! Was thrilled. Worked one time and now fan doesn't come on. Returning and getting something else. Highly disappointed.

I had bought this direct from the manufacture and this is NOT worth the money you pay for it. I got all the neat little accessories for it when I bought it. And I loved it while it worked. Which wasn't very long.

After 1 month - the door to the rotating basket broke. Took 3 months to get a replacement after calling customer service 3 times.

After 4 months the rotating part for the rotisserie and rotating basket stopped rotating. (At this point it's already out of warranty so I thought I could live without that part of it.)

After 6 months the motor conked out. I never moved the machine so I know it had plenty of ventilation. Unplugged it for a few days and plugged it back in and nothing.

I used this probably every other week which to me doesn't seem like I used it heavily but maybe someone else using it less will have better luck with it. For the price though I just think this should last way longer than 6 months.

Awful. Had I known how much of a pain this device was, I never would have gotten it. The main issue is its false advertising. What I mean is, the appliances are advertised to do more than they can. Example, directions and photos show the kabob being full. However, when following the instructions, the kabobs fall apart while in the air fryer because the device is too small to accommodate skewers with meat on them. Also, the rotisserie is a rip off. It says a 4 lb. chicken, if you go one ounce over that 4 lb limit, the chicken is too big to rotate. Third, the rotating basket can turn out some of the most disgusting sides. The phrase "turd okra" will never leave my vocabulary. At this point, the device is nothing but a dissatisfaction and will likely end up in my shed where it will remain until I gift it to someone I don't like.

First one lasted 6 weeks, just quit. Received free replacement. That one lasted less than a month, entire kitchen smelt like burnt plastic. Waiting for another free replacement. Takes weeks to get the replacement. Customer service is ok, but what good is "free" if it doesn't work

I LOVED my air fryer oven... while it worked. After about 6 months it was hit or miss if it would turn on. Then about a month after that, it completely died. When it was working, I used it almost every day. It was fantastic. I’ve since replaced it with a regular air fryer, which I don’t like as much, but at least it works. I should have read the other reviews before buying because this seems like a pretty common problem. It’s definitely not worth the money for how long it lasts.

The burning plastic smell is far worse than you can imagine. The smell is not at all a "new appliance" smell- it is more like a hot toxic plastic smell than does not go away. We had to open up all the doors and windows- the smell scared our dogs, ad saturated our kitchen. This product should not be legal. The box even stinks after trying to use the machine. Even if it did work- it is nothing more than a really crappy convection oven- nothing special- just toxic death fumes.

This review is not about the performance of the power air fryer because I have not yet been able to use it. I also purchased directly from the manufacturer, not Amazon.

My product arrived about two weeks ago, when I opened the box, there were NO manuals. I contacted customer service and informed them of this issue. The customer service representative apologized, and proceeded to ask me for the model number. She said it should be printed on a white or silver label attached to the machine. After thorough examination, I told her there was no label on the machine anywhere. She proceeded with the phone call and told me that she ordered my manuals and I should be receiving them in 7 to 10 business days. They arrived in about 3 business days, which was great!

A couple of days later, I decided it was time to try out my new gadget. I prepared my food and when I plugged in the machine, I received an E1 error code, which is a Broken circuit of the thermal sensor. I tried a different outlet and received the same error. The solution listed in the manual is Contact Customer Service. I called customer service and was told they would have to replace the unit. Really!!! First, no manuals and now the unit doesn't even work!! I received a prepaid Fedex label via email and dropped the unit off today. If this second one doesn't work, I will demand a refund, and never purchase anything else from this company! Ridiculous!!!!

Mine was a birthday gift that I had been wanting for over a year, however, I probably could have waited another year as it really wasn’t what I thought it was. I’m a sucker for the “but wait! There’s more!” commercials. I’ve had a few weeks now and cooked several things that all required adjustments to. My steak fries took forever and a day to crisp up and taste just like oven fries. I laid them flat on the racks and I was less than impressed. I think I’ll try the rotisserie and spray my fries with Pam next time - and use crinkle cut or pixie. I also made salmon packed in foil with lemon, onion, garlic, spinach leaves, and dill and it was over cooked but still tasty. The chicken wings were crispy but the heat sucked the juice right out. I cooked shrimp in the rotis and that turned out perfect as did my toasted ravioli which actually had the fried effect. My frozen pizza had a funky after taste but it did crisp up. My rolls burned and after all of that, I feel that my toaster oven is more controllable. I’ll keep tinkering with it and see what happens.

PROs:
Preset settings
Fried foods do tend to have a fried effect less the oil
Easy to clean
The multiple racks do hold an entire back of fries

CONs:
Not a heck of a lot of room between racks
Takes up a lot of real estate on the counter
Width is lacking for the larger pizzas
Cooking times are way off
Heat setting is off by about 5-8 degrees

Had item for 7 months - fan which distributes heat became dislodged & fell against the fan protection grate. Thus, air fryer is totally non operational. Customer service for company was of no help (after hold period of apx 30 min.). Refused return of product saying past 60 day warranty. Understandable as to why there is only a 60 day warranty on this product. Will confirm, future small appliance purchases are NOT affiliated with Creative Innovators (distributor of this Air Fryer).

I enjoyed the infomercial so I bought one. Instantly I realized that the fryer is too small for a family of four. It cooked already fried food that just had to be heated well. But when using the rotisserie for the smallest chicken I could find it rotated half way and then the chick breast hit the bottom and got stuck. After cooking if as directed but for three times the duration it remain uncooked. Given the small size and limited ability of this appliance I returned it for a refund. There is a learning curve to this appliance, and is limited. If you want to do chicken and fries you will need two machines.

reviews.reviewTitle: How do I love this thing, let me count the ways…
reviews.reviewText:
We replaced our Cuisinart toaster oven with this. We cook a lot of chicken nuggets and frozen pizza as well as reheat leftovers. This air fryer has blown away our expectations.
First of all, it cooks FAST. On the average 25% faster than the cook times on the instructions, even though it only goes up to 400°. I would advise you keep a close eye on your food or it will burn. It also makes things CRISPY. Even leftovers reheat almost to brand-new.
We typically only use one rack as I don't see how you can expect something to cook 3 layers and be crispy. The rotisserie fry basket is amazing. If you fill it really full, it just takes a little longer because there's a lot of stuff in it. But the fries do come out really crunchy.
We have cooked chicken multiple times and it comes out tender with a crisp skin.
As far as cons, only a couple of minor things. The racks do seem a little loose, but they hold. The door also can pop off if you get aggressive while opening it. When food is finished, there are 5 loud beeps when maybe 3 or 4 would do. Again, I'm nitpicking here because we absolutely love this thing. It is a workhorse for us.

reviews.reviewTitle: Smells like burning plastic, ALL THE TIME!
reviews.reviewText: Aweful, just aweful. I love the idea, and I wanted this to work out so bad, but it puts off this horrific burning plastic smell that does not go away in time and the burnt plastic taste gets in all the food. It is so bad and we had to throw away the food. Sad day, I was so excited for this in my tiny house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much more uses than I had thought
reviews.reviewText: I've had this about a month from another dealer and wouldn't do without now. I've done french fries in the tumbler without oil, dried fruit, shish kebab, bacon directly on the rack without having to turn it and as crispy as I want it for breakfast or soft for a BLT, and much more. From some reviews it seems that some people got a lemon. Mine is perfect so far but I did get an extended warranty just in case. I put an oven temperature gauge in it a few times and the readouts are pretty close when it heats up. Mine draws about 13.3 amps but I've not tried to load up the circuit while I"m using it. I suspect the preset buttons are marketing hype because you need to change the cooking time and temperature anyway. The buttons are not a bother and may give you a starting point. This model is a fantastic machine. Since I was talked into this, we have convinced at least two others into buying this model.

reviews.reviewTitle: TRUST THE BAD REVIEWS. Breaks EASILY.
reviews.reviewText: Why do you think the Manufacturer only has a 60 day warranty?! Bottom Line: This works great when it actually works.. but it breaks EASILY. The #1 culprit? The fan stops working. Basically making it a useless brick. Mine was bought exactly on December 31, 2018.. and it broke less than 60 days later. I'm about to call them for Warranty but let's face facts.. just shipping this thing back to them is a huge hassle and the cost is ON YOU. Trust the bad reviews folks. I gave this 1* for durability and another star because it does work great when it's working.. otherwise. Believe what the Manufacturer is telling you.. "you got 60 days and this brick is yours"

reviews.reviewTitle: I Love my Power Air Fryer. Had the original and this one is a definite improvement.
reviews.reviewText:
Update: It broke, luckily I had 4 days left on the short 60 day warranty. They replaced it with the new "Elite". This time I bought the 3 year warranty, highly advised. The Elite is much better built, Mt guess is they will phase out the first gen oven (I'm referring to the oven not original air fryer basket) as they had too many problems with them. Just a guess based on them coming out with an upgraded but so similar product so quickly after launching the oven. Anyway, get the Elite.

Love it. As an owner of the original Power Air Fryer I was skeptical that I'd like this one as much. I need a larger oven and gave it a try. It is truly a huge improvement from the original. I love the easily removable trays (easy to clean) but I really love the rotating basket. I use Orieda Steak fries and they were always dry in the original air fryer. I was going to start using the oven again. With the rotating basket I LOVE my fries. Soft but a tad crispy, just the best. I was concerned that the oven might be a hassle to clean but it's not at all. A paper towel is all it takes to clean the drip tray. One more paper towel to wipe out the inside (doesn't get that dirty) and the trays and basket clean up quick in the sink. I clean the trays after each use (takes a second) and the other stuff after every few times The food does cook on the bottom better than the original but it's still best to turn items halfway through as the heating element is up top. I also cook breaded fish sprayed lightly with canola or sesame oil. Not as good as real fried food but less messy, healthier and a nice variation for a change. I cook my veggie burger's, fish sticks and anything else that I used to put in the oven.

I got this for a Christmas gift and I loved it while it worked. After 7 months it quit working. Apparently there is a fan in the top of the unit which spins to cook the food. Well, the fan started making a weird noise, I smelled something like plastic burning and then it stopped. Now it will no longer power up again. Something that costs this much money should not have a lifespan of 7 months. From what I am reading in the other reviews, this is a common problem, and the manufacturer only provides a 2 month warranty. I hate that my son got this for me for Christmas and now it no longer works. So what now? I loved the product while it worked. Since it has had so many negative reviews, I will have to go with another brand that will stand by their product. BUYER BEWARE!

After using and loving an air fryer with a basket I thought I would appreciate the extra space in a tray style air fryer. The trays are difficult to load, do not cook evenly, are impossible to clean without a brush and are not secure in the machine. The rotisserie was a total flop. Meat would not turn and has very little power unless you use a nugget of meat. Overall, I think the basket for all its shaking that is required is a far better product and cooks in half the time. I really wanted to like this product as it is cute on the counter but...........nope!

This product was great for 6 months until it broke. Since it shuts off automatically I could use it as crockpot basically and have my dinner ready as soon as i walked in the door. After 6 months the fan started making a huge noise and basically just blew hot air. I can’t believe a product at this expense didn’t last a year.
It also leaked oil all over my counter so I had to keep a towel under it.

I was excited to buy this for myself. I wanted a rotisserie and dehydrator. I tried to use this as a rotisserie first. It requires a small chicken, like 2-3 lbs. I found that the ones we had in the freezer from the store were 4. Great. So, the basic chicken from the store wouldn’t work. Next I tried to use the fryer feature. The food was crispy. However, the house smelled like burning plastic and the food had that taste when it finished cooking. We packed it up for a refund.

I like it especially now when it is so hot outside a great alternative to oven, I made chicken tenders, Italian meetballs, fryen chicken tight, really good result especially for the chicken, so crispy outside and juicy inside, I need only 30min to make 2 racks of chicken tenders without drop of oil, the price is high for the 8qt but it was a gift so I can't complain, it bake great, there is little smell of burned oil the first time of use and that is normal just burn it out without food and next time everything is perfect, I would give it 5 stars however you need rotate the racks every 15 minutes if you use more than one and that is Anoying but other than that 5 stars, it really help to reduce the kitchen temperature in summer for that reason I really like it. But of course it is only my personal opinion as you may have totally different expectations.

I never had the chance to cook in it due to the fact that as soon as I turned it on it stunk up my house with a toxic burning plastic and electrical smell. I washed it inside and out according to the instructions before using, but still got the awful smell. I took it outside and cycled it through at least 10 French fry cycles, but the smell never went away. Add that to a stupidly short warranty and horrible customer service. Love the idea, but not keeping this brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only a 60 DAY WARRANTY! Not a return period but a short 60 DAY WARRANTY. Buyer beware!
reviews.reviewText: Purchased new. Worked great for abt 4 months and fan started making clanking noise. Very annoying. Went to website and found there's only a 60 DAY WARRANTY on this. Who does that? No where did I see it had such a short warranty before purchasing. I did see a 60 day guarantee but thought that meant I could return it within that period if I didn't like it. 60 DAY WARRANTY is ridiculous for a product in this price range. I'll say it again, ONLY A 60 DAY WARRANTY! Buyer beware!

I did not get from Amazon but it was a gift. Very skeptical of the As seen on TV stuff bit I have to say this thing works like a charm. It is easy to use and easy to clean. I have cooked a roast on the rotisserie as well as a chicken they were outstanding. It was the main reason I wanted this and it works great. French fries yup they come our great and not greasy cook in no time. In fact the chicken and the roast cooked in no time. Did shrimp and little pastry snacks perfectly cooked and flaky all around. I would highly recommend this device especially the rotisserie model.

reviews.reviewTitle: Racks too small/oven temperature not accurate
reviews.reviewText: Racks are too small; therefore, one side slides off rail and releases other side. Takes several tries to even get empty racks set on the rails and nearly impossible if fryer is hot. Temperature is not accurate so it requires several adjustments to determine a cooking temperature and complete the cooking. I like the fryer but am immensely dissatisfied with this product. We purchased after Christmas 2018 and have used for breaded pork chop, breaded chicken breast, breakfast casserole, frozen Marie Callendar's small pot pies, pork roast using rotisserie and fresh squash breaded. Breaded port chop was the best, pot pies took nearly an hour at 370 to 400 degrees and pork roast was over cooked in 30 min .at 370 degrees. Fresh squash was delicious and cooked perfectly. I would definitely read all the reviews before purchasing this product.

Received this as a Christmas present and within a month it stopped working. I called customer service and they said I could return it to where I purchased it (which I reminded them again it was a gift) or I could pay to ship it back to them and they'd replace it. I shouldn't have to pay to ship a defective product. When I saw they only have a 60 warranty it made me think that they have a cheap product and know it. Definitely would not recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Defective and a bad smell from it
reviews.reviewText: Received as a Christmas Gift and the display unit would t even turn on. The whole unit is defective. Would not recommend at this time. Relative has to return and exchange for a new unit. My mom received the same unit for Christmas as well, hers has the plastic burning smell coming from it while cooking

I have had this a couple of months but due to my busy life-style I had not used it until today. I reheated some french fries in the basket and was happy with the results. I had taken a chicken out to rotisserie for supper. It took twice as long to cook as the recipe called for, but the chicken was delicious. However, cleanup was a bear, with many parts to wash as well as the entire inside of the machine. The parts have places for food particles to hide and dips in parts that required special attention. After only 2 uses the non-stick coating is peeling off the drip tray. Needless to say, I won't be cooking chicken in the machine again! It's easier to buy one for $6 at the local deli. I am hoping the dehydrate and toaster applications will be more satisfying to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Defective after 2 months and then, poor warranty!
reviews.reviewText: To get a replacement, they require you to ship the product to them at your own cost and still ask you to send them a check in the amount of $19.99. I find it malicious, because such an expensive product, first of all, should not malfunction so easily and secondly, should have a better warranty. Yes, it is a fancy gadget, but at the end, you end up with an unreliable product that if you want to have it, it will require you to pay for it more than what you originally paid. Is this a scheme?

There seems to be a common denominator with air fryers......doesn’t matter which brand you buy they all have the same problem......they just stop working for no good reason. I’ve had that happen twice. If you’re lucky you get a good one that’s a work horse, which is what I have now. I wonder if this problem will ever be fixed. I think these machines are the best thing since sliced bread but it’s definitely a crap shoot when it needs replacing.

This is a great product if you don't plan to use it much. We used ours several times a week. The first one heated so hot it melted one of the corners of the door. Contacted the company (with pics) they sent a replacement. 5 months later, one side of the handle has come detached. Contacted the company again to make them aware. Never got a response back. It's sad that it ended up being junk.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke after 1 use. A common complaint.
reviews.reviewText: Broke after 1 use. Similar to others, the fan stopped working. $35 to return a broken product. My fault for not checking on that before I bought this piece of crap item. After so many years, I wonder why the company doesn’t fix this problem since so many have the same issue? They just keep selling them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Food taste like plastic, machine smells like plastic
reviews.reviewText:
Have used it a few times and it Cooks food well.
Unfortunately food comes out with a taste of plastic. I've scrubbed the machine and every accessory but food still comes out with a terrible plastic after taste.

reviews.reviewTitle: smells like burning electric and plastic
reviews.reviewText: Unit smells like burning plastic and when food it cooked it smells and tastes like plastic. Unit is made of plastic inside instead of metal. Easy to use but hard to clean and smell is horrible.

This infomercial product is a total rip-off. Read all the negative reviews. Quits working right after the 60-day warranty expires, so you're stuck with a piece of worthless junk. There are many other air-fryer ovens on the market, read the reviews, shop smart. Take this one down to your local gun range and shoot it. That's all it's good for.

reviews.reviewTitle: Still love it after a year!
reviews.reviewText: This is not plug and play! I bought mine 1 year ago from bed bath and beyond. Read your instructions! Use common sense! When I make keto fried chicken I don't pack all 3 trays and stuff them in... of course you're going to have uneven cooking just as if you were using a regular oven or microwave. I love mine haven't had a bit of problem. I keep it clean and take very good care of it. I just sold this one for $100 so I can get the new elite and that's because I want the side opening door. That's after a year of use because I take care of it and I use my head when using it. Best purchase ever!

My father in law gave me this as a gift for christmas and it stopped working only after a week of being used. I contacted the company and they didnt answer my inquiries, it was amazon who had to solved my problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't use this on your Corian counter top
reviews.reviewText: Thanksgiving we needed more oven space and used the Air Fryer for the first time. After heating up a small casserole for 30 minutes there was a big bang. My Corian counter cracked! Not safe! Expensive stuffing.

Pros:
Works great for fries & nuggets.
Cons : takes up tooooo much space.
Stinks when you use it.
Cheap plastic , door already won’t stay shut on mine .
Racks are hard to clean even in the dishwasher.
I wouldn’t purchase again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor quality, broke down second day, warranties terrible, do not buy this air fryer.
reviews.reviewText: The worst air fryer I have ever seen, first day fixed wings took three times the time to cook it, second day use the rotisserie and nothing happened it didn’t work, definitely a piece of junk took it back right away didn’t wanted in my house anymore who knows what else could’ve happened

It was great, until it broke. I called the company and they graciously offered that even though I was past the 60 day warranty (60 days? They obviously know these all break) that I could pay for shipping and mail it back to them for a free replacement. You know how heavy this thing is, can’t even imagine how much shipping would be

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not buy! Not worth it
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely hated this thing! Every time i used it it smelt like terrible terrible burning plastic!! The entire home would smell! The times suggested for fries and everything else were completely inaccurate!

Worked great for 3 months, then the front door latch started going out. So when you close the doors it doesn't know you did, so then it does not work! Also all the accessories and SO hard to clean its a joke. Threw it out after 4 months!

I bought this for my mom for Mother’s Day and she called me today to tell me that she tried to dehydrate some tomatoes and the fan broke and there are now parts rattling aound inside. Of course the 30 day window has passed. This is really irritating. I would not buy from this seller.

This device cooks great! But, you have to keep it on a dedicated plug (nothing else can run on that power outlet while using it) or you'll trip circuit breaker. I heard some power outlet can handle more than one device (I don't really know).

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked great for 76 days, then quit.
reviews.reviewText: My husband freaking LOVED this unit. Loved that it made frozen fried food crispy is less time. Out of nowhere on the 76th day of owning it, the motor was quieter and we discovered there was no heat. It's not worthless. I'll buy a different brand of large capacity fryer
It does not work as it says. everything burns and sticks. Sometimes it comes on sometimes it does not. I will be returning this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t waist your time or money get the good stuff
reviews.reviewText: For rotisserie this thing is garbage don’t waist your time with it. Bought it at Walmart for cheaper and am taking it back the center rod is not long enough and I don’t think it’s god enough HP. It’s fragile and cheap. Easy touch screen that is all the positive.

reviews.reviewTitle: BUYER BEWARE! WORKED ONCE, THEN NOTHING!
reviews.reviewText: I got this for a Christmas gift. The first time I tried it, I was so impressed. It was easy to use and the food cooked perfectly. Went to use it two days later and it wouldn't work. The power would come on but the control panel would go black. Tried different outlets and no luck. I returned it.
Can’t turn. 4 lb chicken on the spot. Way over cooked a turkey breast at recommended settings. Not a happy camper
Removed from box, smelled like plastic, plugged it in and it was broken. Element would not heat up. Terrible quality.

Ordered from Sam's Club. Used x 2 loved it. 3rd time power button turned on when plugged up. Wouldn't turn panel on. Couldn't get it to do nothing. Had for 3 weeks.Returned. should have read others review.

I'm returning the second of these ovens. I purchased the Walmart version of this product, the only difference is the controls. The concept and function are very good but the strong odor of burning plastic and chemicals is so bad that it even taints the flavor of the food that is being cooked. If not for that I would rate it four stars. In fact I like the concept and function well enough that I have ordered the elite version that has a metal interior, hoping that it will fix the horrible odor. We will see.
I have had my oven for three days and it just quit. I enjoyed it for the last three days. I would not recommend it.

I bought one of these it was great. Then after 6 mons or so It quit cooking the food. Man I was p/o'd. Glad I didn't give my air fryer away, because this oven thing isn't worth it. Would not recommend buying.

Got mine a few months ago. Worked fine until tonight when the inner glass door shattered during cooking (for no apparent reason). Didn't use it all that often because it didn't cook food evenly and always made the house smell like burning plastic. Definitely won't be putting in the effort to buy another one. Will go back to my old toaster oven.
